0.title: Dharmendra shares still with Shabana Azmi from 'Rocky Aur Rani...'
0.article_body: Veteran actor Dharmendra has shared a still with actress Shabana Azmi on Twitter from their upcoming film 'Rocky Aur Rani Ki Prem Kahani'. Dharmendra wrote, "Ishq hai mujhe camera se...aur camera ko...Shaid mujh se (I am in love with the camera and I think the camera loves me)." The film also stars Ranveer Singh and Alia Bhatt.

1.title: Chinese burn 3 am oil, Americans avoid going to work at all: Musk
1.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk praised Chinese workers in a recent interview. He said, "[Chinese] won't just be burning the midnight oil...they'll be burning the 3 am oil...whereas, in America, people are trying to avoid going to work at all." Musk added that most of Tesla's competition would come from China while adding, "There are...supertalented hardworking people in China."

2.title: TDP chief Naidu writes to Amit Shah over ex-AP minister Narayana's arrest
2.article_body: After former Andhra Pradesh Minister P Narayana was arrested on Tuesday, TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu wrote to Union Home Minister Amit Shah and claimed that the YSRCP-led state government made the arrest based on false evidence. Notably, Narayana was arrested in connection with a Class 10 exam paper leak case. However, a court granted bail to Narayana on Wednesday.

3.title: US inflation rises 8.3% in April, slight drop from March's 40-yr-high
3.article_body: Retail inflation in the US rose 8.3% in April from 12 months earlier, the country's Labor Department said on Wednesday. This is however below the 8.5% y-o-y rise in March, which was the highest rate in 40 years since 1981. On a month-to-month basis, prices rose 0.3% from March to April, the smallest increase in eight months.

4.title: Investors lose over ₹13 lakh crore in a four-day decline in stocks
4.article_body: A four-day decline in stocks has wiped out over ₹13.32 lakh crore from the market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms. The BSE Sensex plummeted 276 points to close at 54,088 in its fourth-straight session of decline on Wednesday. Larsen & Toubro, Bajaj Finserv, Bajaj Finance, PowerGrid, NTPC, Infosys and Maruti were among the top losers in the Sensex pack on Wednesday.

5.title: Class 12 student killed, woman injured during street brawl in Delhi
5.article_body: A class 12 student was killed while a woman was injured after a youth attacked them with a knife during a street brawl at a slum cluster in Delhi's Sarai Rohilla, police said on Wednesday. Arzu's (accused) mother and the survivor were quarrelling before the accused intervened and stabbed her and later stabbed the class 12 student to death.

6.title: Raj MLA Girraj Singh surrenders before police in engineers' assault case
6.article_body: Congress MLA Girraj Singh Malinga, who is accused of assaulting two power department engineers in the Dholpur district, surrendered before the police in Jaipur on Wednesday. He said the allegations of assault were baseless. Malinga said he met Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot in the morning and was asked to surrender before the police.

7.title: After I became a mom, designers said, 'Nothing's fitting you': Neha
7.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia recalled her postpartum depression after giving birth to her first child in 2018. "The day you give birth it's...an amazing feeling...And still trying to go to work...then...at fittings people saying 'oh but nothing's really fitting you...maybe we should work...sometime later'," she said. "It's a downward spiral but I've been through it and I've learned," she added.

8.title: Dalits unsafe in BJP-ruled states: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase
8.article_body: NCP leader Mahesh Tapase said that Dalits are "not safe" in BJP-ruled states. He said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi should personally give an assurance of protecting members of the community in the country. Tapase's comment comes after the former head of Pawti Khurd village in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar announced a ban on the entry of Dalits into his fields.

9.title: IAS officer Pooja Singhal accused in ₹18 cr fraud case in Jharkhand arrested by ED
9.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has arrested IAS officer and Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal, who is being investigated in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds. Earlier, a viral video showed over ₹17 crore in cash being recovered during a raid at the house of a CA linked to Singhal.

10.title: No one's talking about the film, we're all stuck at ₹1000 cr: Manoj
10.article_body: Actor Manoj Bajpayee has said, "No one is talking about the film." He added, "No one wants to discuss the film, its performances, the other departments who have contributed in making that film." He stated everyone is stuck at ₹1000 crore. "This fight has been going on for years. I think this mess is not going to end," Manoj said.

11.title: NCP workers protest against inflation in Pune, chant Hanuman Aarti
11.article_body: The Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) led by MP Supriya Sule on Wednesday staged a protest in Pune against rising prices of gas and fuel. "Modiji, we are not angry with you, we are annoyed. How can you show such insensitivity? How can your government be so insensitive?" Sule said. Party activists were also seen performing Hanuman Aarti at the site.

12.title: Heat wave, rainfall warnings issued for several states over 5 days; IMD releases list
12.article_body: Heat wave conditions are very likely over Rajasthan on May 11, 12, 14 and 15 and in Madhya Pradesh on May 11, 13 and 15. They are also likely over parts of Maharashtra on May 11; Uttar Pradesh on May 14 and 15 and Haryana-Delhi and Punjab during May 12-15. Rainfall is likely over Northeast India during next 5 days.

13.title: Modi govt takes decisions that are for the good of the people: Shah
13.article_body: During the launch of the book 'Modi@20: Dreams Meet Delivery', Union Home Minister Amit Shah said, "[PM Narendra Modi] government doesn't take decisions that will please people. It takes decisions that are for the good of the people." PM Modi should be seen from a holistic view and not from an isolated view to understand his political life, Shah added.

14.title: Misleading: Air India on woman's panic attack video after boarding denied at airport
14.article_body: Air India said, "It's conveying a misleading image of Air India being apathetic towards a passenger," after a video showed that a woman allegedly suffered a panic attack at Delhi airport. In the video shared on Instagram, it was alleged the woman and her relatives were denied boarding by Air India staff due to a delay of a few minutes.

15.title: No need to panic: Maha Health Minister on rising COVID-19 cases
15.article_body: Maharashtra Health Minister Rajesh Tope has said that though there is a rise in COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, there is no need to panic. He said that states like Punjab, Uttar Pradesh and Delhi are witnessing a similar spike, but most of the people infected have only experienced mild symptoms. "In Maharashtra, cases are rising but not rapidly," Tope added.

16.title: Punjab HC gave resounding slap to Kejriwal for misusing police: Bagga
16.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Singh Bagga, who was arrested last week, on Wednesday said that the Punjab High Court has given a "resounding slap" to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. "The country used to salute the Punjab Police which had defeated Khalistan," he said. The police is now given the job of arresting people who tweet against Kejriwal, he added.

17.title: Kashmir has startup potential in agri, dairy sectors: Jitendra Singh
17.article_body: Union Science and Technology Minister Jitendra Singh said Kashmir has huge, largely unexplored startup potential in the agriculture and dairy sectors. The youth should look beyond government jobs as a source of livelihood, Singh added. He also assured help to youth from the central government in setting up employment generating units for themselves and others.

18.title: Cummins is a world-class bowler, KKR still benched him: Shastri
18.article_body: Discussing all-rounder Pat Cummins, ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said, "Thankfully KKR...played Cummins [in their win against MI by 52 runs]. [I] wonder what he was doing warming the bench." "He is Australia's Test captain, a world-class bowler and they still benched him," added Shastri. Cummins has taken seven wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 10.68.

19.title: Apple testing folding panel for iPhone and iPad: Report
19.article_body: Apple is developing a new folding OLED screen that would eventually be used in a folding iPhone or iPad, South Korea's TheElec reported. Apple is reportedly developing a polarizer-less OLED screen, the same technology which is used by Samsung in its Galaxy Z Fold3 and its Eco2OLED display. Currently, polarizer is being used in some conventional folding displays.

20.title: File 1,000 FIRs, but I'll keep asking questions: Bagga to Kejriwal
20.article_body: Criticising Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab Police over his arrest, BJP leader Tajinder Bagga said that even if a thousand FIRs are filed against him, he will continue asking questions. Bagga, who was arrested by the Punjab Police last week, claimed that he was arrested for "asking questions". Bagga said he was arrested for reminding Kejriwal of his promises.

21.title: Will take her to ISRO: Smriti Irani on UP girl aspiring to be scientist
21.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani during her visit to Uttar Pradesh's Amethi promised a girl student a visit to Indian Space Research Organisation next month. The polytechnic student had told Irani that she wanted to be a scientist and work at the national space agency. "It's a matter of pride for Amethi that [she] wants to become a scientist," Irani said.

22.title: More pressure on RR than DC, DC are like a wounded tiger: Ajay Jadeja
22.article_body: Ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said there is more pressure on RR than DC in their upcoming match, despite being currently placed third on the IPL 2022 points table. "DC have been so up and down that it's...difficult...to predict what RR will be up against. DC are like a wounded tiger," added Ajay. "They have everything to lose," stated Ajay.

23.title: Telling truth is not treason: Rahul as SC puts sedition law on hold
23.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday welcomed the Supreme Court's order to put the sedition law on hold. Rahul said, "Telling the truth is patriotism, not treason. Listening to the truth is one's duty...Crushing the truth is arrogance." Meanwhile, Congress spokesperson Randeep Singh Surjewala termed the apex court's decision as "historic" and said, "Speaking truth to power can't be sedition."

24.title: 24-year-old man stabbed to death by neighbour in Mumbai
24.article_body: A 24-year-old man, Shubham Dangat, was stabbed to death by his neighbour in Mumbai's Kurla over past enmity. Police said that the accused, Tanaji Kawar, had attacked Dangat's mother with a wooden log in 2017 and was arrested. During a heated argument with Dangat, Kawar, who was out on bail, stabbed him on his head, chest and back, police added.

25.title: 22-yr-old dials 100 citing danger to life at 2:30am, asks police to get beer in T'gana
25.article_body: A 22-year-old man has been booked in Telangana's Doulatabad for allegedly misusing the Dial100 emergency service. Police said the man, who was at a wedding, called on the number and claimed his life was in danger, following which police arrived at the spot. He then told them that he wanted two beer bottles and that the police should get it.

26.title: Jennifer Aniston to be the final guest of 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show'
26.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston will be the final guest in the farewell episode of 'The Ellen DeGeneres Show'. The actress was also Ellen's first-ever guest on the show when it began in 2003. The talk show will be ending after 19 seasons. Along with Jennifer, singers Pink and Billie Eilish will also feature in the episode.

27.title: Hyderabad airport sets up special help desk for Gulf-bound workers
27.article_body: The Hyderabad international airport has set up a special help desk that will run round-the-clock for migrant workers travelling to middle eastern countries. It is located at the international departure terminal. An official said that the presence of a dedicated migrant help desk will help in scrutinising the documents of the travellers and guide them in emigration clearance.

28.title: I mute the TV, I don't pay attention to what people are saying: Virat Kohli on critics
28.article_body: Talking about how he cuts out the outside noise amid his bad form in IPL 2022, Virat Kohli said, "You either mute the TV or don't pay attention to what people are saying. I do both of these things." Kohli has scored 216 runs in IPL 2022 so far at an average of 19.64 and a strike rate of 111.34.

29.title: Rescued after kidnap, woman jumps off 2nd floor in UP police station campus
29.article_body: A 19-year-old woman, who was rescued from Etah a week after she was kidnapped, jumped off the second floor of the Mahila Barrack in the Vijay Garh police station campus in Aligarh on Tuesday. Reports said that the woman was housed at the barracks after being rescued and has sustained serious injuries on various parts of body, including her head.

30.title: Skeletons at Punjab well found belonging to 282 Indian soldiers martyred in 1857 revolt
30.article_body: The skeletons that were dug up in Punjab in 2014 have been found to belong to 282 Indian soldiers who were martyred during India's first freedom struggle against the British in 1857, said Dr JS Sehrawat, Assistant Professor, Department of Anthropology, Panjab University. "These were excavated from a well found underneath a religious structure in Ajnala near Amritsar," he said.

31.title: Woman kills teenage stepsons in UP, police suspect property dispute
31.article_body: UP police on Wednesday arrested a woman for allegedly killing her two stepsons, aged 18 and 15. According to police, Srinavas has two wives - Kusum and Mansa Devi. Around 5 am in morning, Kusum along with her son and daughter-in-law killed Devi's children when she was not at home, police added, suspecting property dispute as reason behind the crime.

32.title: China calls WHO chief 'irresponsible' for criticising its zero-COVID policy
32.article_body: China on Wednesday defended sticking to its strict "zero-COVID-19" approach, calling critical remarks from WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus "irresponsible". Ghebreyesus had said that China's "zero-COVID-19" policy is not "sustainable" considering the behaviour of the virus. Tedros must view China's policy "objectively" and "get more knowledge about the facts", China said.

33.title: Even PM Modi’s detractors agree he is a phenomenon: VP Naidu
33.article_body: While addressing a gathering after releasing the book 'Modi@ 20: Dreams Meet Delivery', VP M Venkaiah Naidu said that even PM Modi's detractors believe he is a phenomenon. He added that while Mahatma Gandhi took the freedom struggle out of the hands of the elite to turn it into a mass movement, PM had converted developmental initiatives into mass movements.

34.title: Sri Lanka CID summons ex-PM’s security head over Monday violence
34.article_body: The Crime Investigation Department (CID) of Sri Lanka has reportedly summoned the security head of former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and other officials in connection with the violence that occurred on Monday. At least eight people have been killed and over 200 injured in the clashes amid protests over the ongoing economic crisis. Several vehicles and properties were reportedly burned down.

35.title: 19% Indian households do not use any toilet facility: NFHS report
35.article_body: According to 2019-21 National Family Health Survey (NFHS), 19% of Indian households don't use any toilet facility and defecate in open as compared to 39% in 2015-16. Bihar has the lowest access to toilets at 62%, followed by Jharkhand (70%) and Odisha (71%). Moreover, 11% of urban households use a shared facility as compared to seven percent of rural households.

36.title: UK mulls law to make espionage punishable by life imprisonment
36.article_body: The UK is planning to introduce a law that seeks to make espionage punishable by life imprisonment, according to a report. Currently, the maximum penalty for the offence is imprisonment up to 14 years. "The Bill will, for the first time, make it an offence to be a covert foreign spy on our soil," said UK Home Secretary Priti Patel.

37.title: If B'wood can't afford Mahesh Babu's price, then very good; to each his own: Mukesh Bhatt
37.article_body: Mukesh Bhatt, speaking to India Today, reacted to Mahesh Babu's 'Bollywood can't afford me' remark. "If Bollywood can't afford his price, then very good...I respect where he comes from. He has talent and he has an 'X' value for the talent," Mukesh added. "Bollywood cannot work to his expectations, there's nothing wrong with it...To each his own," he stated.

38.title: Tiger Global marks its first seed investment in India with Shopflo
38.article_body: E-commerce enablement startup Shopflo has raised $2.6 million in seed funding from Tiger Global and TQ Ventures, making it Tiger Global's first seed investment in India. Others who participated in the funding include Better Capital as well as several angel investors. Shopflo helps D2C brands improve their checkout experience at their own websites and improve conversion rates.

39.title: Please euthanize me: Ex-bus driver writes to PM after being fired by BMTC
39.article_body: An ex-bus driver of Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation had written a letter to PM Narendra Modi and President Ram Nath Kovind, requesting euthanasia for him. He's said to have been fired from BMTC after officials suspected him to have participated in a transport strike. "[Getting] fired means my [children] have fallen out on...street...[I've] no choice, please euthanize me," he wrote.

40.title: Al Jazeera journalist likely killed by Palestinian gunfire: Israel PM
40.article_body: Israeli PM Naftali Bennett said Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh, who was shot during an Israeli military raid in the West Bank, was "likely" killed by "armed Palestinians, who were firing indiscriminately at the time". The 51-year-old was reportedly "shot in the face". Meanwhile, Al Jazeera has accused Israeli security forces of "deliberately" targeting and killing Abu Akleh.

41.title: State laws don't apply to RBI-registered NBFCs: Supreme Court
41.article_body: State moneylending laws would have no application on non-banking finance companies (NBFCs) registered with and regulated by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), the Supreme Court (SC) said on Tuesday. The court observed that the Chapter III­B of the RBI Act is a complete code in itself. Earlier,  the Kerala High Court had said the state moneylending laws were applicable.

42.title: Ex-Mr Universe Calum von Moger fighting for life after falling from 2nd storey window
42.article_body: Ex-World Fitness Federation (WFF) Mr Universe Calum von Moger is fighting for his life after falling from a second storey-window in Australia. The actor and bodybuilder underwent a major surgery after injuring his spine and is currently in induced coma. As per fellow bodybuilder and YouTuber Nick Trigilli, Calum was under the influence of drugs when the incident took place.

43.title: 'My 65-yr-old dad got 10 stitches, broken arm due to Ola e-scooter bug,' claims son
43.article_body: A man named Pallav Maheshwari claimed that his 65-year-old father was "severely injured" due to a "software bug in Ola electric scooter of going in reverse at full speed". "He banged his head on a wall with almost skull open (with 10 stitches now) and broke his left arm which would've to be operated with 2 plates inserted," Maheshwari claimed.

44.title: Don't think RR have high hopes from Boult, he is not reliable: Manjrekar
44.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Sanjay Manjrekar said he doesn't think RR will have high hopes from their pacer Trent Boult, adding that he is not reliable in the middle and death overs. "If he was such an important player, MI would have bid for him," stated Manjrekar. Boult has picked nine wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 8.37.

45.title: Industries to be set up on closed textile mills’ land in UP: State minister
45.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has decided to set up industries on the land of the closed textile mills located in various districts of the state, UP Industrial Development Minister, Nand Gopal Gupta Nandi, said. The land of the closed textile mills will be allotted to entrepreneurs to set up industries or launch new ventures, Nandi added.

46.title: NIA to open office in MP to probe terror activities: MP Home Minister
46.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) will soon open its office in MP to investigate terror activities, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. "The agency is conducting...probe into...activities of terrorist organisations like Al-Soofa and Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB) in the state," he said. Earlier in March, MP police had arrested four alleged members of JMB in Bhopal.

47.title: 12-yr-old girl gang-raped in Pune, 2 men including 18-yr-old arrested
47.article_body: A 12-year-old girl was allegedly gang-raped in the Pimpri-Chinchwad area of Pune district on April 21, following which two accused have been arrested. The men, aged 18 and 21, also allegedly molested the girl a few days after raping her. The 18-year-old is a welder, while the 21-year-old man is a rickshaw-puller and they live in the girl's neighbourhood.

48.title: Marcos visits dictator father's grave after Philippines election win
48.article_body: Ferdinand Marcos Junior visited the grave of his dictator father, Ferdinand Marcos, after winning the Philippines' Presidential election on Tuesday. One of the images shared by Marcos appeared to show him wiping away tears as he stood before the grave. Ferdinand Marcos died in exile in 1989, but his remains were only interred in the Manila "heroes" cemetery in 2016.

49.title: Sorry, studio was full: Kapil to fan who wasn't allowed to give him his sketch
49.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma took to Twitter to retweet a sketch made by one of his fans and apologised after the fan said that he was not allowed to present the sketch to Kapil. "Thank you for beautiful sketch, and sorry for inconvenience, studio was full that's why they didn't allow, see you some other time. Lots of love," Kapil wrote.

50.title: Victory, says Mahua Moitra after SC puts sedition law on hold
50.article_body: Soon after the Supreme Court put the sedition law on hold, TMC leader Mahua Moitra on Wednesday tweeted "Victory". "Supreme Court stays Section 124A - no new cases can be filed, existing cases can apply for bail and release immediately," Moitra added. "Great day for democracy," Moitra said in another tweet.

51.title: 8,500 MW of power available, daily demand 8,300 MW: Haryana Minister
51.article_body: Haryana Power Minister Ranjit Singh Chautala on Tuesday claimed that 8,500 MW of power is available from all the resources in the state, whereas the daily demand for electricity is about 8,300 MW. Chautala added Haryana is the only state managing its power issues with ease, compared to the power crunch being faced in 16 states of Northern India.

52.title: Held for cyber crime, class-10 dropout behind 1,352 cases: Chandigarh Police
52.article_body: Chandigarh Police have arrested a 23-year-old man, Vikas, for cheating woman of ₹83,979 on April 19. Police said that the man is a class-10 dropout and has been involved in 1,352 such cases across the country. The accused used just four IMEI numbers, a 15-digit number that is unique to each device, to carry out all the crimes, police added.

53.title: 8 yrs of PM Modi-led govt led to global debate on terrorism: Jaishankar
53.article_body: Eight years of PM Narendra Modi-led government led to a global debate on terrorism, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said on Wednesday. "He has practised development-focused diplomacy, focused on border infra development to meet security challenges, he takes interest in trade and addressed all our embassies to reach $400 billion exports," Jaishankar added.

54.title: What's cerebral aneurysm, the life-threatening disease Xi Jinping may be suffering from?
54.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping is reportedly suffering from cerebral aneurysm. A cerebral aneurysm is a weak or thin spot on an artery in brain that balloons or bulges out and fills with blood, according to US' National Institutes of Health. Bleeding into the brain from bulging aneurysm can lead to headache, permanent damage to the brain or even death.

55.title: Had to do comedy just 10 days after dad's death, got standing ovation: Krushna
55.article_body: Comedian Krushna Abhishek said that he had to do a comedy show just 10 days after his father passed away because the makers could not take in another anchor. "The performance...I gave that day...Everyone gave me...standing ovation...That this guy, despite facing such a tough time, his father has passed just 10 days ago, and he made everyone laugh," he added.

56.title: 50% women aged 15-24 yrs use cloth for menstrual protection: NFHS Report
56.article_body: According to National Family Health Survey report, about 50% of Indian women aged between 15 to 24 years still use cloth for menstrual protection. Using unclean cloth increases exposure to multiple local infections as well as the risk of cervical cancer, experts warned. The survey, however, stated that overall 78% of women in this age group use a hygienic method.

57.title: Bike with dead body hits speed breaker, reveals murder of B'luru woman
57.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman's murder was revealed after a couple's plan to dispose of her body failed. The couple's friends were going to dispose of her body when their bike hit a speed breaker in front of a DCP's office and they fell. After the accident, police took them to hospital and learned that the woman had died eight hours ago.

58.title: Delhi man forges President's letterhead to promote fake university
58.article_body: The Delhi Police's Special Cell has registered a case against a man for allegedly forging the President's letterhead to promote a fake digital university in Delhi. Amardeep Singh used the President's signature under his own to inform people that India's first digital university, Vikramshila University, was going to be inaugurated shortly. The FIR was registered on May 2.

59.title: 50-tonne concrete segment falls at Ghaziabad project site
59.article_body: A 50-tonne concrete segment fell off at the under-construction Modinagar site of the Regional Rapid Transit System project on the Delhi-Meerut Road in Ghaziabad on Tuesday evening. The concrete segment was being hoisted using a high-capacity crane. "The cable snapped during the load testing...incident took place inside the barricaded area...no damage or any injury took place," an official said.

60.title: 2 babies die at private hospital due to 'medical negligence' in Hyd
60.article_body: At least two new-born babies died at a private hospital in Hyderabad on Tuesday due to medical negligence, their family members have alleged. They claimed that the babies were kept in incubators and added that the babies had burn injuries near their chest and stomach. The family members have not lodged any complaints in this regard, an official said.

61.title: Ukraine successfully struck Russian resupply vessels in Black Sea: UK
61.article_body: Ukraine has "successfully" struck Russian air defences and resupply vessels stationed in the Black Sea with Bayraktar drones, UK Defence Ministry said. "Russia's resupply vessels have minimum protection in the western Black Sea, following the Russian Navy's retreat to Crimea after the loss of the Moskva," it added. The ministry also said that fighting is continuing on Ukraine's Zmiinyi Island.

62.title: HR tech startup Hono raises $5 million led by Aakash Chaudhry
62.article_body: Human resource tech startup Hono has raised $5 million in a funding round led by Aakash Chaudhry, Managing Director of Aakash+BYJU's. Chaudhry has made a personal investment of $4 million. The remaining amount was raised from Hemant Sultania, Amit Khanna of Amaya Ventures, and Harsh Gupta of Udayat Group. Chaudhry will also be part of the board at Hono.

63.title: 24x7 digital payments helpline 'DigiSaathi' now on WhatsApp: NPCI
63.article_body: The government's 24x7 helpline 'DigiSaathi' that provides information on digital payment products and services is now available on WhatsApp, the National Payments Commission of India (NPCI) said. Users can access the helpline by texting +91-892-891-3333 via WhatsApp. It answers queries on cards, UPI, NEFT, RTGS, Wallets, ATM, QR (UPI/Bharat), mobile and net banking, among others.

64.title: Events in Sri Lanka wake-up call for India: Mehbooba Mufti
64.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Mehbooba Mufti on Wednesday said the situation in Sri Lanka should serve as a wake-up call for India. Mufti tweeted, "Since 2014, India is being whipped into a communal frenzy." She added, "It [India] is treading the same path of hyper-nationalism and religious majoritarianism. All at cost of disrupting social cohesion and economic security."

65.title: Biker dies while overtaking truck, Cyberabad Police shares video of accident
65.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Wednesday shared a video showing a man riding a bike being hit by a truck in Gagilapur. The video shows the man overtaking the truck from the left, after which he is run over by the truck. The traffic police said that the man died in the accident.

66.title: Assam CM mistakenly refers to Amit Shah as PM at an event, video surfaces
66.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma mistakenly referred to Amit Shah as Prime Minister and PM Narendra Modi as Home Minister while speaking at a public event. The Assam Congress has shared a video showing Sarma addressing a huge gathering. The Congress asked if a campaign has been launched to promote Union Home Minister Amit Shah as the Prime Minister.

67.title: We respect court, but there's a 'Laxman Rekha': Minister after SC's sedition law order
67.article_body: After the Supreme Court ordered to put the sedition law on hold, Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "We respect the court and its independence. But there's a 'Laxman Rekha' that must be respected by all organs of the state." He added that they have to ensure that they respect the provisions of the Indian Constitution as well as existing laws.

68.title: Playing Draco in 'Harry...' did me no favours with girls in school: Tom
68.article_body: Actor Tom Felton, who played Draco Malfoy in the 'Harry Potter' franchise, said that portraying the negative character "was not cool" for him during his school years. "I wasn't this special, popular kid, but I was walking around with dyed hair and played an evil wizard...It did me no favours with the girls," he added.

69.title: US House approves $40 billion further aid for Ukraine
69.article_body: The US House of Representatives passed a Bill to approve over $40 billion in further aid to Ukraine, which is fighting Russia. "This Bill will protect democracy, limit Russian aggression and strengthen our own national security, while most importantly, support Ukraine," a Democratic Representative said. Some Republican members opposed the move for sending too much of taxpayers' money abroad.

70.title: Pant shouldn't think too much, just smack the ball like Russell: Shastri
70.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri said DC captain Rishabh Pant should just smack the ball like KKR all-rounder Andre Russell, rather than thinking too much. "Who knows, you might win more matches than people expect you to," added Shastri. "[Pant's] getting off to starts and then getting out in a manner which he wouldn't like," stated Shastri.

71.title: Jacqueline moves court for permission to travel abroad after seizure of passport
71.article_body: Jacqueline Fernandez, who is on the radar of the Enforcement Directorate for her connection with alleged conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar, has moved an application in a Delhi court seeking permission to travel abroad to attend the IIFA Awards in Abu Dhabi. She has also sought permission to travel to France and Nepal. The ED has seized Fernandez's passport.

72.title: Kiran Bedi trolled for sharing fake video of shark jumping and pulling down helicopter
72.article_body: Retired IPS officer Kiran Bedi has been trolled for sharing a fake video showing a shark jumping out of the water and pulling down a helicopter. "How can someone even remotely believe this video could be true, let alone an IPS officer," a user wrote. "Is your account hacked?" wrote another. "Laudable, even if manufactured? Sure, cheers!" another comment read.

73.title: Trump asked if China had developed a 'Hurricane Gun' to attack US: Officials
73.article_body: During his tenure as US President, Donald Trump asked his aides if China had a weapon that could shoot human-made hurricanes to attack US, according to a Rolling Stone article quoting officials. Trump began asking his aides about the supposed weapon during first year of his presidency and the issue kept resurfacing until the second year, the officials reportedly said.

74.title: Glad I never had him as a coach: Ex-Man Utd star Evra on Pep Guardiola
74.article_body: Former Manchester United defender Patrice Evra said he is "glad" he was never coached by Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola. "You have the impression that he is playing on the PlayStation," added Evra. "Guardiola doesn't want leaders. He doesn't want personality," he stated. "There is no Plan B. When they are in trouble, what do they do?" said Evra.

75.title: CCTV footage shows moment rocket-propelled grenade hits Punjab Police's Intel HQ
75.article_body: A CCTV footage of the rocket-propelled grenade attack at the Punjab Police's intelligence headquarters in Mohali has surfaced. The video shows a car passing and a flash of light as the grenade hits the Intelligence Wing headquarters. Earlier, Punjab Police arrested a man named Nishan Singh, who allegedly gave shelter to suspects in the blast case.

76.title: Germany reopens its embassy in Ukraine's Kyiv after over 2 months
76.article_body: Germany reopened its embassy in Ukraine's Kyiv after over two months since its closure due to the Russian invasion. German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock, who visited the towns of Bucha and Irpin, where civilian killings were reported, said her country will support Ukraine in probing and prosecuting war crimes. We will support Ukraine at the International Criminal Court, she added.

77.title: Man assaults ex-girlfriend, kills her new boyfriend in B'luru; held
77.article_body: A man allegedly assaulted his ex-girlfriend and beat her new boyfriend to death in Bengaluru. According to police, the 24-year-old woman broke up with the accused a year ago, later entered into a new relationship with her colleague and started living together with him. However, when the accused learned about this, he attacked them. Meanwhile, police have arrested the accused.

78.title: TN teens hurl casteist abuses at 11-yr-old, push him into live fire; booked
78.article_body: Tamil Nadu Police have booked three teenagers for allegedly hurling casteist abuses at an 11-year-old boy and pushing him into live fire in Viluppuram. When his family members enquired about the burns on his body, the class 6 student said he fell on a burning bush. After much coaxing, he revealed that upper caste students from school bullied him.

79.title: Why not let him go?: SC to UP govt on MLA Azam Khan's bail plea
79.article_body: Supreme Court has asked the UP government to file a reply to Samajwadi Party MLA Azam Khan's plea over delay in hearing his bail application in a land grabbing case. "What is this? Why not let him go. He has been in jail [for] two years. One or two cases is okay...it cannot be in 89 cases," the court said.

80.title: China warns US warship sailing through Taiwan Strait
80.article_body: Chinese military on Wednesday said it'd monitored and warned a US warship that had sailed through the Taiwan Strait. "The US frequently stages such dramas and provokes trouble, sending wrong signals to Taiwan independence forces and deliberately intensifying tensions across the Taiwan Strait," it added. The ship transited through Taiwan Strait "in accordance with international law", US Navy said.

81.title: Was 15 kg more than my usual weight during Mimi, felt unfit: Kriti Sanon
81.article_body: Actress Kriti Sanon said she remembers feeling unfit towards the end of schedule of the movie 'Mimi' and added she was 15 kilos more than her usual weight. "I began working out at home with help of virtual trainers. I lost all the excess weight during the lockdown...When you feel so unfit, you understand the importance of fitness," she added.

82.title: Man arrested for putting up Khalistan flags outside Himachal Assembly
82.article_body: One of the two men accused of putting up Khalistan flags at the Himachal Pradesh Vidhan Sabha gate was arrested on Wednesday. The arrested person, Harbir Singh alias Raju (30), is a resident of Punjab's Rupnagar, police said. The accused had also scrawled graffiti on the boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Assembly at Tapovan near Dharamshala on May 8.

83.title: BJP's biggest weakness is its dependence on PM Modi: Prashant Kishor
83.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor on Tuesday said that BJP's biggest weakness at present is the party's dependence on Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Commenting on BJP's biggest opposition threat between AAP and Congress, he added, "Congress, any day." Congress needs to learn how to be in opposition and how to behave like an Opposition party, Kishor further said.

84.title: 800 WhiteHat Jr employees resign after being asked to return to office: Report
84.article_body: More than 800 employees of kids online coding learning startup WhiteHat Jr, which was acquired by BYJU'S, have resigned in the last 60 days after they were asked to return to their offices, Inc42 reported. WhiteHat Jr's full-time employees from various teams across the company resigned. They were asked to report to their respective offices in a month's time.

85.title: Shopkeeper held for stalking 20-yr-old former employee in Ludhiana
85.article_body: Police on Tuesday arrested a shopkeeper in Ludhiana for stalking his former employee and sending her lewd messages. According to the 20-year-old woman's father, the shopkeeper used to harass her following which she quit the job. "But after she quit...he started sending her lewd messages. When his repeated calls to her went unanswered, he reached our house," her father stated.

86.title: Musk says Tesla is open to buying a mining firm in push for clean energy
86.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has said that Tesla is open to buying a mining company in a push for the worldwide adoption of clean energy technologies. "It's not out of the question. We will address whatever limitations are on accelerating the world's transition to sustainable energy. It's not that we wish to buy mining companies," he added.

87.title: Man killed, his 3-yr-old son injured in celebratory firing in UP, 2 held
87.article_body: Two men were arrested in UP’s Muzaffarnagar after a 35-year-old man was killed and his three-year-old son was injured in a celebratory firing during a wedding, police said on Tuesday. The incident occurred late on Monday night. "Two wedding guests have been arrested. They were found involved in celebratory firing," Station House Officer (SHO), Vinod Kumar, said.

88.title: Split verdict by Delhi HC on criminalising marital rape, matter referred to SC
88.article_body: After hearing petitions challenging the exception to Section 375 of IPC, which exempts forced sexual intercourse by a man with his wife, from the offence of rape, the Delhi High Court's two-judge bench arrived on a split decision. Referring the matter to Supreme Court, Justice Rajiv Shakdher held the exception unconstitutional while Justice C Hari Shankar said it wasn't unconstitutional.

89.title: They can't feel what I feel, they can't live my life: Virat Kohli on critics amid poor form
89.article_body: Talking about critics questioning him over his poor form, RCB batter Virat Kohli, in an interaction with Danish Sait, said, "They can't be in my shoes. They can't feel what I feel." He added, "They can't live my life. They can't live those moments." Kohli further said that he doesn't pay attention to the "outside noise".

90.title: I feel insulted: Bengali writer returns award as Mamata Banerjee gets literary honour
90.article_body: Bengali writer Ratna Rashid Banerjee has returned the 'Annada Shankar Smarak Samman' given to her by the Paschimbanga Bangla Academy over its decision to confer a special award on West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "I feel insulted. The statement of the Academy praising the relentless literary pursuit of the honourable Chief Minister is a travesty of truth," Banerjee said.

91.title: 'Disgusted' with actors in India: 'Raajneeti' director Prakash Jha
91.article_body: Director Prakash Jha who helmed 'Raajneeti' starring Ranbir Kapoor and Katrina Kaif, said he is "disgusted" with actors working in India. "They don't know what acting is about," added Jha. Discussing his web series 'Aashram', Jha stated, "'Aashram' has 1.6 billion views which is probably the most viewed web series in the world. It is double the size of IPL."

92.title: Man rapes 14-yr-old girl in Delhi, buries dead infant after abortion; held
92.article_body: Police have arrested a 23-year-old man, Dharamender alias Raj, for raping and impregnating a 14-year-old girl in Delhi after befriending her. Police said that Raj told victim to not disclose pregnancy to anyone and took her to an alleged female doctor who gave her abortion pills. The victim delivered a dead infant next day. The infant was buried by accused.

93.title: Stablecoin UST, that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, crashes to 40 cents
93.article_body: TerraUSD or 'UST', a stablecoin that's meant to maintain a $1 peg, plunged over 55% on Wednesday from 24 hours earlier to around 40 cents. Its sister token fell more than 80% to $5 and other cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin and Ether also plunged. A stablecoin is a digital currency pegged to a "stable" reserve asset like the US dollar.

94.title: Insecticide & plastic ingredients found inside pregnant women: Study
94.article_body: Dozens of chemicals used to make plastics and those found in insecticides were found in several pregnant women during a study that analysed 171 pregnant women in the US. Scientists looked for 89 different chemicals in participants and found 73 of them in at least one person. Moreover, 36 of these substances were found in over 50% of the participants.

95.title: Maha court sentences man to life imprisonment for raping 8-yr-old girl
95.article_body: A court in Maharashtra sentenced a man to life imprisonment for raping an eight-year-old girl. The incident occurred in 2017 when the accused allegedly took the girl to an isolated place and raped her. The girl's parents later found her bleeding in the custody of the accused. The incident took place in Sativali area of Palghar.

96.title: Allah made him for me, his caste never mattered: Hyd murder victim's wife
96.article_body: Syed Ashrin Sultana, wife of Dalit man Billipuram Nagaraju, who was killed by Sultana's brother in Hyderabad said his caste never mattered to her. "I never even used to look at him as Hindu. I only thought he was made for me...that Allah made him for me," she added. Sultana said she never thought her brother would kill her husband.

97.title: Aayush Sharma pens note after death of his grandfather and ex-minister Pandit Sukh Ram
97.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma penned a note after the death of his grandfather and former Union minister Pandit Sukh Ram. "Even though you're gone, I know you'll always be with me, guiding me, looking over me and blessing me like you always do. Rest in peace dadaji, you will be dearly missed," the actor wrote.

98.title: BP Care Juice reduced high BP of 91% of users in 3 months: Kapiva
98.article_body: Kapiva Academy of Ayurveda claims 91% of its consumers observed a drop in high blood pressure with BP Care Juice, while 69% reduced their allopathy medicine dosage. The juice contains Arjuna, Shankhpushpi, Guggul, and 7+ herbs, which lowers blood pressure, improves blood circulation, reduces bad cholesterol, strengthens heart muscles, and reduces the risk of heart disease, Kapiva added.

99.title: Maha govt to speed up vaccination drive to combat possible 4th wave
99.article_body: Amid rising COVID-19 cases in Maharashtra, the state government has decided to speed up the vaccination process to combat the fourth wave that may arrive by June or July. "There are people who refuse to take...vaccine...Due to them, the vaccination number...is low," Health Minister Rajesh Tope said. If cases rise, the mask mandate will also be brought back, he added.

100.title: 6-month-old girl found gagged in bushes in Punjab’s Zirakpur
100.article_body: A six-month-old baby girl was found in roadside bushes in Punjab's Zirakpur on Tuesday. The baby, who was gagged and covered with a cloth, was noticed by two motorcycle-borne youths, police said. "The infant was rushed to a hospital in Dhakoli and was found stable," Sub-Inspector Rajinder Singh, Zirakpur police station, said.

101.title: 3 people injured in separate leopard attacks in Pune district
101.article_body: Three people were injured in three separate incidents of leopard attacks in Khed and Ambegaon talukas of Pune district on Tuesday night and Wednesday early morning. Of those injured, two are women and one of them is critical. The two places of attack are located around one-and-half-kilometre away from each other. Forest rangers have stepped up vigil in these areas.

102.title: Felt like I've seen everything now: Kohli on smiling after 2nd golden duck in IPL 2022
102.article_body: Virat Kohli, in a video shared by RCB, said he felt helpless after he recorded his second golden duck in IPL 2022. "It hasn't happened to me ever in my career...That's why I smiled because I felt like I've seen everything now. It has been so long that I have seen everything this game has to show me," Kohli added.

103.title: Earthquake of magnitude 4.6 strikes Pithoragarh in Uttarakhand
103.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.6 on the Richter scale hit Uttarakhand's Pithoragarh on Wednesday morning. According to the National Center for Seismology (NCS), the quake struck at around 10 am, at a depth of five kilometres. The tremors were felt about 20 km northeast of Pithoragarh, NCS tweeted. According to reports, there was no loss of life or property.

104.title: Passenger with no flying experience lands plane in US after pilot falls unconscious
104.article_body: A passenger with no flying experience safely landed a 14-seater Cessna 208 Caravan plane at a Florida airport after the pilot fell unconscious. The passenger contacted air traffic controllers and was heard saying, "I've got a serious situation here...My pilot has gone incoherent. I've no idea how to fly the airplane." The controllers located the plane and guided the passenger.

105.title: 43,489 students miss Class 10 board exams in Odisha, govt orders probe
105.article_body: As many as 43,489 students missed their Class 10 board exams in Odisha that ended on May 7. Odisha government has ordered a probe after it was found out that 5.71 lakh students had filled up forms for exams and only 5.3 lakh appeared. Officials have been directed to conduct a school-wise analysis and submit a report within 10 days.

106.title: ASI expresses concern after J&K LG Manoj Sinha prays at protected Sun Temple: Report
106.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India has "expressed concern to the administration" after Jammu & Kashmir Lieutenant-Governor Manoj Sinha participated in prayers at the ruins of protected eighth-century Martand Sun Temple, The Indian Express reported. The agency reportedly said no permission was sought to conduct the ceremony and asked the administration to ensure such violations are not repeated.

107.title: Teen couple found hanging from tree in Rajasthan village
107.article_body: A 19-year-old man and an 18-year-old woman, reported to be lovers, allegedly hanged themselves to death from a tree in a village in Rajasthan's Jhalawar district. They also consumed poison, a bottle of which was found nearby, according to police. No suicide note was found at the site, added police. The couple had gone missing on Monday night.

108.title: Al Jazeera female journalist shot in the face by Israeli forces: Qatar minister
108.article_body: Al Jazeera journalist Shireen Abu Akleh was shot dead by Israeli troops on Wednesday as she covered a raid on Jenin refugee camp in the occupied West Bank, the network said. Qatar's Assistant Foreign Minister Lolwah Al-Khater said that Akleh was shot "in the face". Al Jazeera added that the 51-year-old was shot "deliberately" by Israeli troops.

109.title: Arjun's very controversial but doesn't get bad press like I do: Kangana
109.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut said actor Arjun Rampal is "very controversial" but doesn't get bad press like she does. "He says what he says, does what he does," added Kangana. "A guy can get away with anything," stated Kangana. Arjun and Kangana will star together in the upcoming film 'Dhaakad' which is a spy thriller scheduled to release on May 20.

110.title: Uttarakhand govt increases daily cap on pilgrims to Char Dham
110.article_body: The Uttarakhand government has decided to increase the daily number of pilgrims by 1,000 each to Yamunotri, Gangotri, Kedarnath and Badrinath, CM Pushkar Singh Dhami said. With this, 13,000 devotees can have 'darshan' at the Kedarnath Dham while 16,000 pilgrims can visit Badrinath in a day. As many as 5,000 and 8,000 devotees can visit Yamunotri and Gangotri respectively.

111.title: Google to pay over 300 news publishers in EU, more to follow
111.article_body: Google has agreed to pay over 300 publishers across the EU for their news and will roll out a tool for others to sign up too. However, Google has not revealed how much publishers will be paid. The EU had earlier adopted the copyright rules that require Google and other online platforms to pay news publishers for using their work.

112.title: Several offices at Vishveshwarya Bhawan in Patna gutted in fire; no casualties
112.article_body: Several offices were destroyed after a major fire broke out at the Vishveshwarya Bhawan (also called the technical secretariat) on the Jawahar Lal Nehru Marg in Bihar's Patna around 7:30 am on Wednesday. The preliminary cause of the fire is said to be a short circuit. Some labourers trapped inside the building were rescued timely. No casualty was reported.

113.title: Apologise to North Indians or go back: BJP MP ahead of MNS chief's Ayodhya visit
113.article_body: Ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s visit to Ayodhya on June 5, BJP MP Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh has demanded a public apology from him for calling North Indians "criminals" in the past. "Raj Thackeray, who called North Indians criminals, should either apologise or go back," read the posters circulated by the BJP MP.

114.title: Rahul seeks permanent relief from court appearance in defamation case
114.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has sought permanent exemption from appearing before a court in Maharashtra's Bhiwandi in a defamation case. He has been accused of defaming the RSS by holding it responsible for the killing of Mahatma Gandhi. In his application, Gandhi said being an MP, he has to visit his constituency and travel a lot for party work.

115.title: Man molests 18-year-old girl at housing society swimming pool in Pune
115.article_body: An 18-year-old girl was allegedly molested by a 47-year-old man at a housing society swimming pool in Pune. The victim said that the accused had also passed lewd remarks and told her, "If you are dressed like this, you are bound to get attraction." The victim's mother has lodged a complaint with the Kondhwa Police against the accused.

116.title: Disabled UPI payments because of informal pressure from RBI: Coinbase CEO
116.article_body: Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong has said that the cryptocurrency exchange suspended its UPI payment method due to informal pressure from Reserve Bank of India (RBI). "India's Supreme Court has ruled that they can't ban crypto, but there are elements in the government there, including RBI, who don't seem to be as positive on it," he further said.

117.title: Elon Musk's tweets on taking Tesla private were reckless: US judge
117.article_body: A US judge said in an April judgement that Tesla CEO Elon Musk's 2018 tweets on taking Tesla private were inaccurate and reckless, adding "there was nothing concrete" about financing from Saudi Arabia's PIF. "Rather, discussions between Tesla and the PIF were clearly at the preliminary stage," the judge added. Musk has insisted that tweets were entirely truthful.

118.title: Man assaults 26-year-old DU student over speaking in English
118.article_body: A 26-year-old Delhi University student was allegedly assaulted by a man after a fight over speaking in English. The incident occurred at a grocery store in Malviya Nagar. According to the FIR, the men got into an argument and the victim, identified as Anshuman Thapa, allegedly pushed the accused, who then ordered his pitbull to attack Thapa.

119.title: Pits for bodies dug before couple came from US: Report on Chennai double murder
119.article_body: The accused who killed the Chennai couple who had returned from the United States had already dug pits for their bodies before they arrived in India, reports said, adding, police found pair of gloves and burnt cell phone on ground where the two were buried. "When we saw this, we confirmed that definitely a murder has been committed," Police said.

120.title: Some current Hindi films very boring, painful: 'LOC...' actor Himanshu
120.article_body: Actor-turned-director Himanshu Malik who starred in the war film 'LOC: Kargil' said he finds some of the current Bollywood films "very boring" and "painful". "The world is one big marketplace. That puts a lot of pressure on traditional filmmakers," added Himanshu. "Once you go behind the camera...you can enjoy eating everything without worrying about gaining weight," stated Himanshu.

121.title: Stop partisan politics, treat everyone equally: WB Guv urges state govt
121.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday met victims of post-poll violence and asked the state government to stop "partisan politics". While comparing the victims of Birbhum's Bogtui village, where eight people were burnt alive, Dhankhar said that if they can get compensation, then those affected by post-poll violence should receive it too. "Everybody should be treated equally," he added.

122.title: Man who set woman on fire 2 days before her wedding in Gurugram held
122.article_body: A 22-year-old man, who allegedly set a 24-year-old woman on fire two days before her wedding in Gurugram, has been arrested, police said. "The man said he couldn't see her getting married to someone else so he tried to kill her," the police added. The man poured petrol on her when she refused to call off the wedding, police stated.

123.title: India denies sending troops to Sri Lanka, says 'fully supportive of its democracy'
123.article_body: The Indian High Commission on Wednesday categorically denied "speculative" reports about India sending troops to Sri Lanka. It said, "These reports and such views are not in keeping with the position of the Government of India." It added, "The Spokesperson of Ministry of External Affairs clearly stated that India is fully supportive of Sri Lanka's democracy, stability and economic recovery."

124.title: 13 boys aged between 13 and 15 harass 2 female tourists in Egypt; arrested
124.article_body: Thirteen boys aged between 13 and 15 have been arrested after being accused of harassing two female tourists at Egypt's Giza Pyramids. In a video of the incident, one of the female tourists can be seen attempting to push one of the boys away from her. The boys said they were trying to take photos with the women.

125.title: 8 charged for selling Pakistani MBBS seats in J&K, using money for terrorism
125.article_body: A Srinagar court has charged eight people, including a Hurriyat leader, for selling Pakistani MBBS seats in Jammu and Kashmir. The accused, in association with educational consultancies, were allegedly arranging admissions of J&K residents in MBBS and other courses in Pakistani colleges and universities. The money thus earned from the parents of the students was used in supporting terrorism.

126.title: MP policeman kills 6-yr-old for demanding money, dumps body in Gwalior
126.article_body: A police head constable allegedly killed a six-year-old boy in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district for demanding money from him and dumped his body in Gwalior, an official said. The accused, who was posted in Gwalior, was arrested, police said. The policeman claimed he was suffering from depression and got irritated when the boy kept asking for money, police added.

127.title: Wife of health inspector run over by train in Ambala
127.article_body: The wife of a health inspector in Ambala was run over by a train near Jandli Fatak on Tuesday. She left home at 9 am and was hit by the train an hour later. Police informed her family using a phone number they found in her wallet. Her husband said she had not been keeping well lately and was stressed.

128.title: Sri Lanka Prez warns of racial & religious tensions amid riots
128.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa urged people to reject attempts to foment "racial and religious disharmony" as violent clashes broke out in many parts of the country over the government's handling of the economic crisis. "This is the time for all Sri Lankans to join hands as one," Rajapaksa added. At least eight people have been killed in the clashes.

129.title: Don't say comedy is in danger due to me: Munawar on Sunil Pal's vulgarity remark
129.article_body: After comedian Sunil Pal asked comedian Munawar Faruqui to save comedy from vulgarity, the latter said he respects comedy as much as Sunil does. "Please don't say that comedy is in danger because of me...We all can save comedy together. Your way is different...You said I don't have 'aukaat' (worth), I'll make my worth," he added.

130.title: Thane man held for spiking drinks of female friends, sexually assaulting them
130.article_body: Thane police arrested a 33-year-old man for allegedly spiking the drinks of women and sexually assaulting them. He was arrested following a complaint by a 23-year-old woman. The accused usually befriended women and asked them out on pretext of celebrating their birthday or any similar occasion, police said. He would then spike their drinks and assault them sexually, police added.

131.title: Supreme Court puts sedition law on hold
131.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday put the sedition law on hold and urged Centre and states to refrain from registering any FIRs invoking Section 124A of IPC. The court allowed the Centre to re-examine and reconsider the provisions of Section 124A and said that no case will be registered under the section till the exercise of re-examination is complete.

132.title: Kuldeep Yadav is too slow in the air, always a gamble for DC: Manjrekar
132.article_body: Former India batter Sanjay Manjrekar said DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav is a bit "too slow" in the air which always makes him a gamble for DC. "If Kuldeep works on his fitness and flight and overcomes his natural weakness, he will be more effective," added Manjrekar. Kuldeep has picked 18 wickets in 11 IPL 2022 matches so far.

133.title: SP-rank officer may be asked to monitor registration of sedition FIRs: Centre to SC
133.article_body: The Centre has told the Supreme Court that a Superintendent of Police-rank officer can be made responsible for monitoring registration of FIRs for the offence of sedition. The government added that staying provisions of sedition may not be the "correct approach". With regard to pending cases, the Centre suggested that hearing on bail pleas in such matters may be expedited.

134.title: I saw 'RRR', it blew my brains; loved 'KGF 1' and 'Pushpa': Ranveer
134.article_body: Speaking about films like 'RRR', 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'KGF: Chapter 1', actor Ranveer Singh said, "'RRR' blew my brains. I loved 'Pushpa: The Rise' and 'KGF: Chapter 1'. I am dying to see 'KGF: Chapter 2'." "I am a huge fan of Allu Arjun, Yash," added Ranveer. "[The] technical aspects of these films are impressive," stated Ranveer.

135.title: What is tomato flu, reported in over 80 children in Kerala?
135.article_body: Tomato flu has been detected in over 80 children aged below five in Kerala. Tomato flu is an unidentified fever that causes rashes and blisters which are generally red in colour. Symptoms of the disease include skin irritation, body aches and high fever. Infected children can also have joint swellings, tiredness, cramps in the stomach, nausea, vomiting and diarrhoea.

136.title: Pakistani rupee falls to all-time low against US dollar
136.article_body: The Pakistani rupee fell to an all-time low against US dollar on Tuesday in the interbank market. Its value surged by 82 paisa in early trade and is currently trading at PKR 188.35 in the interbank market. Meanwhile, State Bank of Pakistan's foreign exchange reserves fell by $328 million to $10.558 billion during the week that ended on April 23.

137.title: Gold coloured chariot washes ashore in Andhra amid cyclone Asani; video goes viral
137.article_body: A video showing a gold coloured chariot washing ashore in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam district amid cyclone Asani has gone viral on social media. The chariot is suspected to have washed away from a faraway Southeast Asian country due to the impact of the cyclone, local residents said. People from neighbouring areas rushed to Srikakulam to see it.

138.title: Urdu teacher jailed for life for raping 6-yr-old girl in Rajasthan
138.article_body: An Urdu teacher has been sentenced to life imprisonment for raping a six-year-old girl at a madrassa in Rajasthan's Kota. The court also imposed a fine of ₹1 lakh on the 43-year-old convict, Abdul Rahim. According to the prosecutor, the man raped the victim when she was alone with him after other students left the class.

139.title: Putin likely to impose martial law in Russia to support war effort: US
139.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin will "likely" impose martial law in Russia to support the war in Ukraine, Director of US National Intelligence, Avril Haines, said. Putin may also order more industrial production to make up for lost resources in the war or order "potentially escalatory military actions to free up...resources needed to achieve his objectives" in Ukraine, Haines added.

140.title: 26-year-old DU student attacked by dog over speaking in English
140.article_body: A 26-year-old Delhi University student was allegedly assaulted by a man and attacked by his dog over speaking in English. The incident occurred at a grocery store in Malviya Nagar. According to the FIR, the men got into an argument and the victim, identified as Anshuman Thapa, allegedly pushed the accused, who then ordered his pitbull to attack Thapa.

141.title: Nehru couldn’t lie in court: Mahua on govt’s remark on sedition law
141.article_body: TMC leader Mahua Moitra reacted to Solicitor General Tushar Mehta’s statement made on Tuesday in the Supreme Court regarding the sedition law. "What Pandit Nehru couldn't do, the current government is doing, says SG Tushar Mehta. You are right, sir. Nehru couldn't lie in court, spy on countrymen, arrest innocents, lock-up dissenters with no due process," Moitra tweeted.

142.title: Deplatforming is a big deal: IT minister Chandrasekhar to Musk on Trump's Twitter ban
142.article_body: Union Minister of State for Electronics and Information Technology Rajeev Chandrasekhar on Wednesday tagged Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Twitter and wrote, "Deplatforming is a big deal" on a news article about former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey backing Musk's plan to reinstate former US President Donald Trump's Twitter account. Chandrasekhar also wrote, "It's a violation of fundamental rights of users."

143.title: J&K separatist leader Yasin Malik pleads guilty in 2017 terror case
143.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir separatist leader Mohammad Yasin Malik has pleaded guilty to all charges, including those under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA), before a Delhi court in a case related to alleged terrorism and secessionist activities that disturbed the Valley in 2017. The court will hear the matter on May 19 and decide the quantum of sentence for Malik.

144.title: Veteran Congress leader Pandit Sukh Ram passes away at 95
144.article_body: Veteran Congress leader Pandit Sukh Ram passed away aged 95 in Delhi on Wednesday morning. He had suffered a brain stroke last week. After initial treatment at Netaji Subhash Chander Bose Zonal Hospital in Mandi, he was airlifted to Delhi and admitted to AIIMS on Saturday. He served as the Union Minister of Communications and Information Technology from 1993-96.

145.title: Kerala fire officer arrested in RSS worker's murder case
145.article_body: An officer of Kerala's fire department was arrested on Tuesday in connection with the murder of an RSS worker, SK Srinivasan, in Palakkad last month. According to police, the 31-year-old accused, identified as Jishad, has close links with the Popular Front of India (PFI) and is suspected to have helped the group that killed Srinivasan.

146.title: SC refuses to stay K'taka HC order of trial against man for raping wife
146.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to stay a Karnataka High Court order that allowed the trial of a man in a marital rape case following a complaint against him by his wife. The trial had been stayed for over five years and the woman had been waiting indefinitely for the trial to commence, the wife's advocate said.

147.title: I agree with Musk on bans, Trump's ban was a business decision: Dorsey
147.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey has said that he agrees with Tesla CEO Elon Musk that there shouldn't be permanent bans on individual Twitter users. This comes after Musk said he will reverse former US President Donald Trump's permanent Twitter ban. Dorsey said Trump's ban was a "business decision" and that "it shouldn't have been".

148.title: Encroachment shouldn’t be seen through lens of religion: Delhi BJP chief
148.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta said encroachment and illegal construction should not be viewed through the lens of religion. "When encroachment doesn't see religion, why should action against illegal constructions be viewed with that lens?" Gupta added. "Those who see it as an issue of specific communities being targeted are only doing so for their vote bank politics," Gupta stated.

149.title: MSRTC's first electric bus Shivai to run from Pune to Ahmednagar on June 1
149.article_body: Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC)'s first e-bus called 'Shivai' will be running from Pune to Ahmednagar from June 1. Reports said that the electric busses will be launched in a phased manner. "We have not yet got the official circular...about June 1 program, but...it is announced from head office, we have already started preparations," MSRTC Pune divisional controller said.

150.title: Felt like life's purpose was fulfilled: Akshay on being offered 'Prithviraj'
150.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar said that he felt proud when Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi offered him the film 'Prithviraj'. "I felt like my life's purpose has been fulfilled...I realised he [Prithviraj] was such a great warrior. In school...there used to be just one paragraph about him...I am extremely proud to work on the film," Akshay added.

151.title: New Zealand to fully reopen international borders from July-end
151.article_body: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern said the country will fully reopen its international borders from July 31 after a pandemic lockout of over two years. Reopening the borders would help relieve urgent skills shortages, revive tourism, and put immigration on a more secure footing, she added. "We're building on our proven plan to secure New Zealand's economic future," Ardern said.

152.title: Belarus to deploy special forces near border with Ukraine
152.article_body: The Belarusian armed forces said it will deploy special operations troops to three areas near its border with Ukraine. "The US and its allies continue to build up their military presence on the state borders of…Belarus," Chief of General Staff Viktor Gulevich said. Belarus is also deploying air defence, artillery and missile units for drills in the west, he added.

153.title: Delhi govt to develop 2 water bodies in Burari as 'safe open spaces'
153.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said two lakes in Satya Vihar and Lakshmi Vihar Extension colony in Burari will be developed as 'safe open spaces'. The minister was inspecting the development work of the two lakes which were recently revived using natural and cost-effective methods. Notably, the government is reviving 23 lakes under the 'City of Lakes' project.

154.title: Police arrest man who gave shelter to suspects in Mohali blast case
154.article_body: Police have arrested a man, Nishan Singh, who allegedly gave logistics support to suspects in the Rocket-Propelled Grenade blast that took place at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali on Monday. Police said Singh provided shelter to two accused in Amritsar for three days before the blast. Reports said that Singh was arrested with help of inputs provided by NIA.

155.title: Mysterious fish with bulging yellow eyes caught in Russia, pic surfaces
155.article_body: A mysterious fish with bulging yellow eyes was pulled from 1,100 metres deep in Russia. Deep-sea fisherman Roman Fedortsov shared the picture of the sea creature on Instagram. "Are these actual rare species we don’t talk about or rare abnormalities due to pollution?" a user commented. "We still don’t know what is in our oceans," wrote another.

156.title: LSG mentor Gambhir's dressing room speech after loss to GT goes viral, says 'We gave up'
156.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir's dressing room speech following their defeat against GT went viral. In the video shared by LSG, Gambhir said, "There's nothing wrong in losing. It's absolutely fine. There's a lot wrong in giving up." He added, "Today...I thought that we gave up. We were weak. Honestly, there's no place for being weak in a tournament like IPL."

157.title: Karnataka govt bans use of loudspeakers from 10 pm to 6 am
157.article_body: Amid the Azan row, the Karnataka government issued new guidelines on Tuesday and banned the use of loudspeakers from 10 pm to 6 am in the state except in closed premises like auditoriums, conference rooms, community halls and banquet halls. Those who wish to use loudspeakers must obtain written permission from the authorities within 15 days, it added.

158.title: Clear ₹122 billion dues or we'll be forced to shut down power plants: China firms to Pak
158.article_body: More than two dozen Chinese firms operating in Pakistan on Monday said that they would be forced to shut down their power plants this month if the country does not clear the ₹122 billion dues, the Dawn reported. They said the authorities were pressuring them to maximise generation to meet peak summer needs.

159.title: Starlink resisted Russian hacks, but they're ramping up efforts: Musk
159.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a report on Russia attacking satellite internet in Ukraine said, "Starlink has resisted Russian cyberwar jamming and hacking attempts so far, but they're ramping up their efforts." Western nations' officials said Russia took tens of thousands of modems offline when the war started. Viasat's KA-SAT network had faced the attack in late February.

160.title: Musk jokingly agrees to hand over Twitter's control to YouTuber MrBeast if he dies
160.article_body: Elon Musk jokingly agreed to hand over control of Twitter to 24-year-old YouTuber MrBeast if he dies. Musk had tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya," after Roscosmos chief Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin accused the Tesla CEO of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," Rogozin said.

161.title: Woman beaten to death in Gujarat for spreading rumours; 4 booked
161.article_body: Police booked four persons for allegedly beating up a 60-year-old woman to death in Gujarat's Borsad. Her son alleged one of the accused called him while he was at work and said he had assaulted his mother as she was spreading rumours about him and his wife. When her son reached home, they also assaulted him with sticks and rods.

162.title: COVID compounded challenge of fighting global warming: Union Minister
162.article_body: The COVID-19 pandemic has "compounded the challenge" of fighting global warming as economic pressures have delayed the progress of climate action around the world, Union Minister Bhupender Yadav said on Tuesday. Yadav added that India has made significant progress in its commitment to restore 26 million hectares of degraded land by 2030.

163.title: India reports 2,897 COVID-19 cases, 54 deaths in 24 hours
163.article_body: India has reported 2,897 COVID-19 cases, 2,986 recoveries and 54 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,288 COVID-19 cases and 10 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,494, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,157.

164.title: MP minister Inder Singh Parmar's 22-yr-old daughter-in-law found hanging
164.article_body: Madhya Pradesh School Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar's 22-year-old daughter-in-law, Savita Parmar, was found hanging at their residence in Shajapur on Tuesday, ANI reported. Her body was sent for a post-mortem on Wednesday morning. The cause of the incident is said to be a "family problem" although police are yet to confirm the same, as per a report.

165.title: Ugandan woman smuggles drugs in intestine, remanded in Chennai
165.article_body: A Ugandan woman, who was found smuggling drugs in the form of capsules in her stomach, was sent to 14-day judicial custody on Tuesday. The 33-year-old accused was arrested at Chennai International Airport on May 6 after officials scanned her and found several capsules in her intestine. Forty capsules containing drugs were removed from her stomach at government hospital.

166.title: 89% of children between 6-23 months do not get 'minimum acceptable diet': NFHS
166.article_body: According to the National Family Health Survey (NFHS-5), 89% of children between the ages of 6-23 months do not get a "minimum acceptable diet". Among all states and UTs, the proportion of children aged 6-23 months who received adequate diet was highest in Meghalaya at 28.5%, while it was the lowest at 5.9% each in UP and Gujarat.

167.title: Shubman Gill reacts to getting trolled for 'slow knock', shares tortoise and hare emoji
167.article_body: GT's Shubman Gill took to Twitter to react to a news article about him getting trolled for his "slow knock" in his team's victory against LSG. He posted an emoji of a tortoise and a hare, seemingly referring to the fable, where the tortoise beats the hare in a race. Gill was named Player of the Match for scoring 63*(49).

168.title: China's zero-COVID policy not sustainable: WHO chief
168.article_body: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus on Tuesday said that China's zero-tolerance COVID-19 policy is not sustainable considering the behaviour of the virus. WHO emergencies director Mike Ryan said the impact of a "zero-COVID" policy on human rights also needs to be taken into consideration alongside the effect on a country's economy from any COVID policy.

169.title: 4 Russian Governors resign amid worsening economy
169.article_body: Four Russian Governors resigned amid a declining economic trend owing to the sanctions imposed by the West over the Ukraine war. The heads of Tomsk, Saratov, Kirov and Mari El regions resigned, while the Governor of Ryazan region said he would not seek another term. "Kremlin was removing weak Governors amid a worsening economic outlook," said a Moscow-based think tank.

170.title: ABVP protests against Dalit prof in UP over remark on Kashi temple
170.article_body: ABVP staged a protest against Lucknow University's Associate Professor Ravi Kant, a Dalit, over "objectionable" comments on Varanasi's Kashi Vishwanath temple. The student body campus chief said that Kant expressed regret over his remark but later posted on social media that ABVP wanted to lynch him. Meanwhile, Kant said the comments were not his personal opinion but a book reference.

171.title: I would steal a lot of things: Azma Fallah on 'Lock Upp'
171.article_body: Azma Fallah who was recently seen in the first season of reality show 'Lock Upp' said she would "steal" a lot of things while participating in the show, adding she would hide things someone became obsessed with. "I did not have the strength to fight back but I could attack them through these actions," stated Azma.

172.title: Naseeruddin said 'You play the fool and the fool's the wisest': Ranveer
172.article_body: Sharing an interaction with actor Naseeruddin Shah, Ranveer Singh said, "Naseer sir told me, 'You choose to play the fool and the fool is actually the wisest one'. I am happy to be the court jester." "My wife [Deepika Padukone] keeps telling me that you are so intelligent but we don't often get to see that side," added Ranveer.

173.title: Will stay at Tesla as long as I can be useful: Elon Musk
173.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on being asked about how long he expects to stay at Tesla, said, "As long as I can be useful." Musk, who is in talks to buy Twitter, is expected to become the platform's temporary CEO. Earlier in July 2021, Musk had said he has tried "very hard not to be the CEO of Tesla".

174.title: AAP protests against 'poor' construction work at Vajpayee Stadium in B'luru
174.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) held a protest in Bengaluru on Tuesday against "poor" construction work at Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium. "The gallery roof [at the stadium] has collapsed barely two months after getting inaugurated by CM Basavaraj Bommai. This is an example of...40% commission corruption of...BJP government and local MLA Satish Reddy," Bengaluru AAP President Mohan Dasari said.

175.title: EA and FIFA to end partnership, FIFA game to be called EA Sports FC from 2023
175.article_body: Electronic Arts (EA) and FIFA have announced that they are ending their decades-long partnership.
