FIFA said it'd launch new football video games developed by third-party studios and publishers, but added it has granted a new short-term extension to EA Sports to launch 'FIFA 23' this year. EA said that it'll rebrand EA Sports FIFA as EA Sports FC from 2023.

176.title: Sri Lanka Army denies reports claiming armed forces ordered to shoot at protestors
176.article_body: Sri Lankan Chief of Defence Staff and Commander of the Army, General Shavendra Silva, on Tuesday denied reports claiming that the armed forces have been ordered to open fire at anyone looting public property or causing harm to others. Silva added that the members of the armed forces would not resort to any such disgraceful acts under any circumstances.

177.title: Over 80,000 devotees visit Kedarnath Dham on 5th day of opening of shrine
177.article_body: More than 80,000 pilgrims visited Kedarnath Dham on the fifth day of the opening of the shrine on Tuesday. "From the helipad located in Kedarnath Dham to the temple, there is a long queue of devotees to have darshan," Ayush Agrawal, SP, Rudraprayag, said. "Six devotees who came to Kedarnath pilgrimage have died due to deteriorating health," he added.

178.title: Andhra Pradesh intermediate exams on May 11 postponed to May 25 due to Cyclone Asani
178.article_body: Andhra Pradesh's Board of Intermediate Education has postponed exams scheduled for May 11 to May 25. "Rest of the examination schedule from May 12 remains unchanged...examination centre venues and the timings are unchanged," it added. This comes after the India Meteorological Department issued a red warning for Andhra Pradesh, as severe cyclonic storm Asani has changed its track.

179.title: Internet suspended in Raj's Bhilwara after 22-yr-old stabbed to death
179.article_body: A 22-year-old man was stabbed to death in Kotwali Police Station area of Rajasthan's Bhilwara on Tuesday. Following the incident, police forces have been deployed in the area. "Internet services in Bhilwara to remain suspended till 6 am on Thursday, 12th May," Bhilwara District Collector, Ashish Modi, said. Reports said that the man was killed following a monetary dispute.

180.title: Woman acquitted of slapping female police constable at Mumbai pub
180.article_body: A sessions court recently acquitted a 44-year-old woman for allegedly slapping a female police constable at a pub in Mumbai. The incident occurred on New Year's Eve in 2011 during a scuffle over the closing time of the pub. The court acquitted the woman after finding that she had accidentally touched the constable's cheek in an attempt to rescue herself.

181.title: Supertech asks SC for time till August 28 to demolish Noida twin towers
181.article_body: Supertech asked Supreme Court for an extension of the deadline to demolish the Noida twin towers till August 28, which were scheduled to be demolished on May 22. Edifice Engineering needs more time to ensure there is no mishap during the blast, officials said. "The only reason we need extension is to ensure...job is done with...safety," an official added.

182.title: Bengaluru reports 121 new COVID-19 cases; active cases at 1,802
182.article_body: Bengaluru reported 121 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the number of active cases in the city to 1,802. In the last 24 hours, Bengaluru has reported zero coronavirus-related deaths and 124 new recoveries, according to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP). The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.09%, data showed.

183.title: Death registrations in several states fell in pandemic year: Data
183.article_body: Despite the onset of COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, the number of deaths registered in several states including Telangana, Uttar Pradesh, Kerala, Uttarakhand and UT of Delhi saw a decline, according to Civil Registration System data. UP recorded 8.73 lakh deaths in 2020, down from 9.44 lakh in 2019. In the same year, the overall death registrations in the country increased.

184.title: We're trying to do what Pandit Nehru couldn't do then: Centre to SC on sedition law
184.article_body: Senior Advocate Kapil Sibal who was representing petitioners challenging the sedition law in Supreme Court on Tuesday said, "We're in post-constitution era. Pandit Jawaharlal Nehru had said this provision is obnoxious and the sooner we get rid of sedition, the better." Representing the Centre, Solicitor General Tushar Mehta, said, "We're trying to do what Pandit Nehru could not do then."

185.title: South director said 'where has she come from', I cried after coming home: Nikki
185.article_body: Actress Nikki Tamboli said that director of a South movie ill treated her. "He was not treating me right on the set...He was literally saying, 'Where has she come from?'" Nikki said, adding, "He was the worst I should say...I have even cried after coming home...I was so tortured by that director, that I would come home and cry."

186.title: Ford sells its shares in Tesla-rival Rivian for $214 million
186.article_body: Ford Motor has sold 8 million shares of Tesla-rival Rivian for $214 million, or $26.80 apiece, the automaker revealed in a filing. It now holds 93.9 million shares in the electric vehicle maker. Shares of Rivian fell nearly 21% on Monday following a CNBC report that revealed the sale of 8 million shares by Ford Motor.

187.title: Hyderabad Police busts illegal inter-state transporting of ganja, 1 held
187.article_body: Hyderabad's Nacharam Police, along with the sleuths of the Special Operations Team, busted an illegal inter-state transporting of contraband ganja. The drug was being transported from Sileru on the Andra Pradesh-Odisha border to Narayankhed of Sangareddy, police added. One person was arrested and 22 kilograms of ganja and one bike were seized from his possession, police further said.

188.title: Independent Ukraine's 1st President Leonid Kravchuk dies aged 88
188.article_body: Leonid Kravchuk, who served as the first President of independent Ukraine, died on Tuesday at the age of 88. Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy described Kravchuk as a wise leader who guided the country in the chaotic first years of independence from Soviet rule. "He was a person always able to find wise words," Zelenskyy said.

189.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as GT qualify for playoffs?
189.article_body: With their win against LSG, GT moved to the top of the IPL 2022 points table with 18 points and qualified for the playoffs. LSG are placed second on the table with 16 points and a net run-rate (NRR) of 0.385. RR and RCB have 14 points each, while DC, SRH, KKR and PBKS have 10 points each.

190.title: I was 117 kg during my U-19 days: CSK's 21-year-old spinner Theekshana
190.article_body: CSK's 21-year-old spinner Maheesh Theekshana has revealed he was 117 kg during his Under-19 days. "I had to work harder to get my weight and skin folds down in the yo-yo test. In 2020, I got everything down and brought my fitness to the required level," he added. "I never thought CSK would bid for me this year," he stated.

191.title: I will reverse the 'flat-out stupid' Twitter ban on Donald Trump: Elon Musk
191.article_body: Elon Musk on Tuesday said that he will reverse Twitter's ban on former US President Donald Trump, adding that the ban was "morally wrong and flat-out stupid". Musk further said that the ban amplified Trump's views among people on the political right. Musk recently inked a $44 billion deal to acquire the social media platform.

192.title: Mumbai man held for wife's murder as police find blood stains on his nails
192.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 22-year-old man for his wife's murder after they found blood stains on his nails. The man, Manoj Prajapati, and his wife, Reema Yadav, were staying separately for few days. Reema's friend later found her lying in pool of blood. Police said Reema's throat was slit. Manoj was questioned after blood stains were found on his nails.

193.title: Bill Gates tests positive for COVID-19
193.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates took to Twitter on Tuesday and wrote, "I've tested positive for COVID-19. I'm experiencing mild symptoms and am following the experts' advice by isolating until I'm healthy again." "I'm fortunate to be vaccinated and boosted and have access to testing and great medical care," he added.

194.title: IPL auction is important, 50% of the job is done on auction table: Gambhir
194.article_body: Stressing on the importance of IPL mega auction, LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir said, "50% of the job is done on the auction table. It helps the management when you pick a good side." He added, "But as long as they don't perform on...field, it doesn't matter even if you pick the best possible players." It's LSG's maiden IPL season.

195.title: Over 50 bonded labourers rescued from a brick kiln in UP's Bhadohi
195.article_body: In a joint raid conducted by the district administration, labour department and the police department, 55 bonded labourers including children were rescued from a brick kiln in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi. Labour Enforcement Officer Pratima Maurya said that all the rescued workers hailed from Chhattisgarh. The brick kiln owners Jameel Khan and Hayat Khan fled from the spot, Maurya added.

196.title: Fake reports: Indian High Commission on rumours of SL politicians escaping to India
196.article_body: The High Commission of India in Colombo, Sri Lanka has denied reports that some Sri Lankan politicians have escaped to India amid the economic crisis in the country. "High Commission has recently noticed rumours circulating...that certain political persons and their families have fled to India. These are fake and blatantly false reports, devoid of any truth or substance," it tweeted.

197.title: Once I started to understand game bit more, was always fan of Kohli: Gill
197.article_body: On being asked about his greatest inspiration, GT opener Shubman Gill said while growing up, it was Sachin Tendulkar. "Once he retired and once I started to understand the game a bit more, I was always a fan of Virat [Kohli] bhai," he added. With 384 runs from 12 matches, Gill is currently the leading-scorer for GT in ongoing IPL.

198.title: India assisting other nations in fight against COVID-19: JP Nadda
198.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda said that India is assisting other nations in the fight against COVID-19 under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi. Crediting PM's leadership for the COVID-19 vaccines, he said, "We've given 18.5 crore vaccine doses to 100 countries." The Opposition is forced to seek votes based on development because of PM Modi, he added.

199.title: Father shoots son dead after a scuffle in UP's Kaushambi
199.article_body: Police said that a man shot at his son with his licensed gun after a scuffle in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi, adding that the youth died during treatment. Reports say that the accused, Shiv Narayan, a farmer, lived with his sons Rakesh Singh and Brajesh Singh. The victim, Brajesh, received injuries to the chest and neck and collapsed, the police added.

200.title: Second hate speech case registered against ex-Kerala MLA PC George
200.article_body: A new hate speech case has been registered against ex-Kerala MLA PC George, a few days after he was arrested and released for making communal remarks. Kochi City Police Commissioner Nagaraju Chakilam said George has violated the bail conditions by making the same mistake again. He was earlier arrested on May 1 for allegedly making controversial statements against Muslims.

201.title: GIC, Tiger Global among 64 anchor investors for Delhivery IPO: Report
201.article_body: Logistics startup Delhivery's IPO, which opened for the anchor investors on Tuesday, attracted as many as 64 investors, Moneycontrol reported. These include GIC, Tiger Global Investments and Goldman Sachs Funds among others. ICICI Prudential Flexicap Fund, HDFC large and mid-cap fund and entities from SBI were reportedly also part of the list.

202.title: Female anti-Romeo squad constable raped by fellow policeman in UP
202.article_body: A female constable of the anti-Romeo squad was abused and raped by a fellow policeman in Uttar Pradesh on the pretext of marriage. The accused surrendered 70 days after the woman complained and has been sent to judicial custody. The victim had written to the Superintendent of Police complaining about the same, after which a formal case was registered.

203.title: GT beat LSG to record their biggest win, become 1st team to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs
203.article_body: GT defeated LSG by 62 runs to record their biggest win (by runs) in IPL 2022. With the win, GT moved to the top of the points table and became the first team to qualify for the IPL 2022 playoffs. Shubman Gill top-scored for GT with 63*(49), while their vice-captain Rashid Khan recorded bowling figures of 3.5-0-24-4.

204.title: Man City confirm agreement to sign Haaland in deal reported to be worth £51.5 million
204.article_body: Manchester City have confirmed a deal to sign Erling Haaland from Borussia Dortmund this summer. The striker's buyout clause, reported to be £51.5 million, has been met by Manchester City. The Norway international will earn £375,000 per week excluding bonuses. Haaland will join the club on July 1, subject to the club finalising terms with the player.

205.title: Govt calls out Twitter for violating India's free speech laws: Bloomberg report
205.article_body: The government has called out Twitter for violating the Indian Constitution and free speech rights, Bloomberg reported. The Ministry of Information Technology objected to the suspension of lawyer Sanjay Hegde's Twitter account about three years ago in a court filing last week, it further added. It had earlier said the matter was for Twitter and Hegde to resolve.

206.title: DC captain Pant is almost at his best when he's reckless: Vettori
206.article_body: Discussing Rishabh Pant's form in ongoing IPL, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said the DC captain is almost at his best when he's "reckless". He added, "We've seen him play some exceptional innings when he just continues to take teams downtime and time again." Pant has scored 281 runs from 11 matches so far. DC are currently fifth in standings.

207.title: $800 billion wiped off crypto market's value in a month
207.article_body: Crypto assets lost $800 billion in market value over the past month, touching a low of $1.4 trillion on Tuesday, as per data site CoinMarketCap. This comes as world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin briefly hit a 10-month low on Tuesday before rebounding to $31,450. Meanwhile, stablecoin TerraUSD lost a third of its value as it lost its peg to the dollar.

208.title: Pfizer to buy Biohaven for $11.6 bn in its biggest deal since 2016
208.article_body: Pfizer will acquire biotech group Biohaven Pharmaceuticals for $11.6 billion, marking its biggest deal since 2016. Biohaven's Rimegepant medication, used as both a treatment and preventative for migraines, is expected to bring in sales of over $4 billion by 2030. This comes as Pfizer expects sales of its COVID-19 vaccines to drop from last year's highs.

209.title: India's outward FDI drops nearly 50% y-o-y to $3.39 bn in April
209.article_body: India's outward foreign direct investment (OFDI) nearly halved to $3.39 billion in April on an annual basis, data released by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) showed. In comparison, the OFDI stood at $6.71 billion in April 2021 and $3.44 billion in March 2022. The equity component in April was $544.87 million and loans amounted to $764.25 million.

210.title: Netflix may begin crackdown on password-sharing by end of 2022: Report
210.article_body: Netflix could launch lower-priced ad-supported plans in the final three months of 2022 and begin cracking down on password-sharing during the same time, the NYT reported. It said the details were mentioned in a note to Netflix employees by the company's executives. Notably, Netflix lost subscribers for the first time in over 10 years in the first quarter of 2022.

211.title: I'd like to meet him: Musk as Twitter user shares pic of his 'Chinese lookalike'
211.article_body: After a Twitter user shared a picture of Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk's Chinese lookalike, Musk said, "I'd like to meet this guy." Musk, however, said he wasn't sure if the man was real, adding, "(It's) hard to tell with deepfakes these days." "Should we deploy Chinese Elon Musk as a decoy?" the user had asked.

212.title: Not about North or South, it's about coming up with good entertainers: Jackky
212.article_body: Actor-producer Jackky Bhagnani has said, "It's not about North or South, it's about coming up with good quality entertainers." He added, "All kinds of audiences enjoying one particular film is actually great. [The] common audience is telling us something and we must listen." This comes after films like 'RRR', 'KGF' franchise and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercially successful across India.

213.title: Cocaine worth $14 million found near diver's body in Australia
213.article_body: Australian police on Tuesday launched a probe after 50 kg of cocaine (worth $14 million) was found near the body of a diver at a riverbank in New South Wales state. The deceased, whose identity is yet to be ascertained, was found by authorities in an unconscious state on Monday. Investigators have searched an overseas-registered ship docked near crime scene.

214.title: 44 members of right-wing groups detained over protest to rename Qutub Minar
214.article_body: As many as 44 members of right-wing organisations, who recited Hanuman Chalisa outside Delhi's Qutub Minar and demanded the minaret be renamed 'Vishnu Stambh', were detained on Tuesday, DCP South said. The demonstrators alleged Qutub Minar was built by "great king Vikramaditya", but Qutubuddin Aibak later claimed credit for it. "Permission was not granted for the gathering," the DCP added.

215.title: CM Gehlot was celebrating birthday during Jodhpur violence: Nadda
215.article_body: BJP national president JP Nadda on Tuesday said that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot was busy celebrating his birthday when there was violence in Jodhpur. "Every time we open a newspaper, we see a new incident happening in Rajasthan," he said. The state is on top for atrocities against women, Dalits and the state's leaders are involved in corruption, he added.

216.title: Don't test our patience: MNS chief to Maha CM on loudspeaker issue
216.article_body: Amid the loudspeaker issue in Maharashtra, MNS chief Raj Thackeray in his letter to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray told the state government to 'not test the party's patience'. In his letter, Raj Thackeray said that over 28,000 MNS workers were served notices. He also questioned why many MNS workers were arrested even before they began protesting against loudspeakers in mosques.

217.title: TMC's Abhishek Banerjee to inaugurate party headquarters in Guwahati
217.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Abhishek Banerjee will visit Guwahati on Wednesday to inaugurate a new state headquarters and meet the TMC's state leadership. The announcement comes weeks after ex-Congress leader Ripun Bora joined TMC as head of party's Assam unit. "We're planning to fight the panchayat polls in Assam and field candidates in...Lok Sabha elections," a TMC leader said.

218.title: Akhilesh Yadav & his uncle Shivpal meet at wedding in UP, don't talk
218.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav came across his uncle Shivpal Yadav at a wedding in Lucknow but the two leaders didn't talk to each other. They were present at the wedding of the nephew of former Uttar Pradesh DGP Jagmohan Yadav. Akhilesh had last month said that Shivpal Yadav, who heads Pragatisheel Samajwadi Party-Lohia, has a soft spot for BJP.

219.title: Set your priorities right: Congress to Punjab CM after Mohali blast
219.article_body: Punjab Congress president Amarinder Singh Raja on Tuesday asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to set his priorities right and focus on serious challenges confronting the state. The "audacious terror attack" at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali was an attempt at exploiting the inexperience of the current government, he said. Mann had earlier said that a probe was underway.

220.title: Bulldozer badnaam hua, encroachment tere liye: Naqvi on Shaheen Bagh
220.article_body: Amid a row over the demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh, Minority Affairs Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Tuesday said, "Bulldozer badnaam hua, encroachment tere liye". He added that it has become a fashion to give a "communal colour" to criminal acts, and asserted that "legal action" against "illegal acts" should be supported.

221.title: E-scooter fires are very rare, but they may occur in the future: Ola Electric CEO
221.article_body: Ola Electric's CEO Bhavish Aggarwal said at a private company event that incidents of electric scooters catching fire are "very rare and isolated", as per Reuters. However, he noted that there might be such occurrences in the future. Aggarwal said, "There'll be, sometimes, some minor defects in, maybe the cell, maybe something else, which will cause some internal short circuit."

222.title: Man attacks wife with an axe during a domestic dispute in Lucknow
222.article_body: Police said that a 35-year-old woman is critical after she was attacked with an axe by her husband during a domestic dispute in Uttar Pradesh's Lucknow. They said that the victim, Laxmi Devi, suffered injuries on her neck, hand and waist. The accused fled the spot after the incident and efforts are on to arrest him, police added.

223.title: Apple discontinues iPod after 20 years
223.article_body: Apple on Tuesday announced that it is discontinuing the iPod touch, its last remaining music player model in the market. "iPod touch will be available while supplies last," the company said in a blog. Apple had introduced the first iPod on October 23, 2001, which had the capacity to store 1,000 songs in MP3 format and a 10-hour battery life.

224.title: Release date of 'Ek Villain 2' postponed, will now release on July 29
224.article_body: The release date of Arjun Kapoor-starrer 'Ek Villain Returns' has been postponed. Taking to Instagram, the film's director Mohit Suri wrote, "'Ek Villain Returns' gets a new release date, 29th July 2022." The film was initially slated to release on July 8. The film also stars Tara Sutaria, John Abraham, and Disha Patani.

225.title: BJP paying lip-service to people displaced from PoJK: Ex-minister
225.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Minister Ajay Kumar Sadhotra on Monday accused the BJP of delivering "lip service" to people displaced from the Pakistan-occupied J&K (PoJK). "BJP is raising false slogans besides rhetoric on every crucial issue. The way the PoJK-displaced people have been treated speaks volumes about its insensitivity towards their plight," he said.

226.title: Russia to skip UNHRC's session on Ukraine, calls it 'new political show'
226.article_body: Russia has said that it will not participate in UNHRC's special session on the Ukraine crisis, describing the upcoming event as a 'new political show'. Russia's Ministry of Foreign Affairs spokesperson Maria Zakharova further said that Moscow's explanations of its ongoing military offensive in Ukraine will be ignored "yet again". Russia was suspended from the UNHRC on April 7.

227.title: Why only Assam?: Yechury asks Shah to remove AFSPA from other states
227.article_body: CPI(M) general secretary Sitaram Yechury on Tuesday urged Union Home Minister Amit Shah to withdraw the Armed Forces Special Powers Act (AFSPA) from other Northeastern states. "Why do not you withdraw AFSPA from everywhere? Is there a political motive behind this? There will be some conspiracy to provoke communal polarisation again," he said

228.title: Never dreamt I'd come this far: Dhanush on 20 yrs in film industry
228.article_body: After completing 20 years in the film industry, actor Dhanush took to Twitter and wrote, "Time flies, never did I even dream I'd come this far when I started 'Thulluvadho Ilamai'." "I can't thank my fans enough for the continuous love...support, you are the pillars of my strength," he added. Dhanush will next be seen in 'The Gray Man'.

229.title: Spain dismisses spy chief over scandal involving Pegasus spyware
229.article_body: Spanish spy chief Paz Esteban has been dismissed over a dual phone-hacking scandal involving Pegasus spyware, Defence Minister Margarita Robles said. "Of course there are security flaws and there will continue to be," Robles said. Spain's National Intelligence Centre is also being questioned over its failure to prevent PM Pedro Sanchez and other officials' phones from being hacked using Pegasus.

230.title: IMD issues red alert for Andhra Pradesh as Cyclone Asani changes track
230.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a red warning for Andhra Pradesh, as severe cyclonic storm Asani has changed its track. According to the IMD, Cyclone Asani is likely to touch the coastal belt in Andhra Pradesh between Visakhapatnam and Kakinada on Wednesday morning. The cyclone is likely to further weaken into a depression on Thursday morning.

231.title: Kejriwal thought himself above law, court proved him wrong: Bagga
231.article_body: After Punjab and Haryana High Court put a stay on his arrest till July 5, BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga said, "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal thought he was above law, but the court proved him wrong." He further alleged that Punjab Police are tracking those who are tweeting or speaking against Kejriwal instead of focussing on their real duty.

232.title: India looking at tapping new markets for edible oil: Sitharaman
232.article_body: India is looking at tapping new markets for the import of edible oils, following the conflict between Ukraine and Russia, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Tuesday. "There are various hurdles in terms of importing oils. You know we are not able to import edible oil; we were getting sunflower oil. Now, we are not," she said.

233.title: Axis Bank awaits probe report on alleged mutual fund scam: Report
233.article_body: Axis Bank will wait for the report on an investigation into alleged front-running at Axis Mutual Fund (MF) before taking the final decision on penalising guilty officials, Moneycontrol reported. The allegations are being probed by two external agencies appointed by Axis MF. The probe was launched in February 2022, Axis MF MD and CEO Chandresh Nigam said on May 8.

234.title: 40 places raided as CBI probes NGOs over FCRA licence, MHA officials questioned
234.article_body: The CBI raided 40 locations in a nationwide crackdown on NGOs in connection to alleged Foreign Contribution Regulation Act (FCRA) violations, reports said on Tuesday. The agency is investigating alleged collusion between government officials and NGO representatives for illegal FCRA licence clearances in exchange for bribes. Six Ministry of Home Affairs officials are reportedly being questioned.

235.title: Historic Pak bridge swept away by glacial lake's water amid heatwave
235.article_body: Pakistan's historic Hassanabad bridge was swept away by a glacial lake outburst flood (GLOF) amid a persistent heatwave. Videos that surfaced on social media showed water slamming against the concrete of the bridge, leading to the collapse of the bridge. The Shishper glacier reportedly started melting due to the heatwave that led to the floods over the weekend.

236.title: BYJU'S buys Northwest Executive Education for $100 mn: Report
236.article_body: BYJU'S group company Great Learning has reportedly acquired Singapore's executive education firm Northwest Executive Education in a stock and cash deal of around $100 million. "BYJU'S is aggressively focusing on the higher education segment...Northwest Executive's acquisition will just add to it," a source told Moneycontrol. In February, Great Learning had bought out recruitment platform Superset.

237.title: 9-yr-old girl raped & murdered by a relative in MP, man arrested
237.article_body: Police said that a nine-year-old girl was allegedly raped and murdered by a distant relative, during a marriage function in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district. They said that the 24-year-old accused was arrested in the case. During interrogation, the accused confessed to the crime and said that he killed the victim to hide the crime, the police added.

238.title: LSG are peaking at the right time in IPL: Jaffer
238.article_body: Talking about table-toppers LSG, ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said KL Rahul-led side are peaking at the right time in IPL 2022. He added that they won their last match against KKR with a big margin of 75 runs and every match of theirs has gone down the wire. "They've never lost any matches as a one-sided affair," he further said.

239.title: Equity investors' wealth falls over ₹11.22 lakh crore in 3 days
239.article_body: Equity investors have become poorer by over ₹11.22 lakh crore in three days following a sell-off in markets amid weak global cues. Sensex fell for the third consecutive session on Tuesday, falling 1,337.38 points or 2.4% since Friday. Foreign institutional investors remained net-sellers on Monday, offloading shares worth a net ₹3,361.80 crore.

240.title: Fight for your rights like Jignesh Mevani: Rahul to tribals in Gujarat
240.article_body: Addressing tribals in Gujarat's Dahod on Tuesday, Congress' Rahul Gandhi urged people to seek inspiration from Vadgam MLA Jignesh Mevani for his "fearless fight" against BJP. Gandhi launched 'Adivasi Adhikar Satyagraha' campaign today ahead of state's Assembly polls. Jignesh Mevani has been sentenced to three months in jail by Gujarat court for holding an 'Azadi' march in 2017 without permission.

241.title: MP man who helped people during COVID-19 booked for raping 27-yr-old
241.article_body: A 34-year-old man who helped people during the second wave of COVID-19 was booked for allegedly raping his 27-year-old tenant in Bhopal, police said on Tuesday. The woman in her complaint said that Javed Khan first raped her on March 3 while her husband was at work. He continued the act till April 25 after which the family shifted.

242.title: Chris Hemsworth is godly, he's also kind & good actor: Elizabeth Olsen
242.article_body: Elizabeth Olsen called Chris Hemsworth "godly" and added, "His arm is way bigger than my head...he's also a charming, kind and good actor." Elizabeth and her 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' co-star Benedict Cumberbatch were asked to agree or disagree if Hemsworth was the most handsome actor in the MCU, to which they both agreed.

243.title: Goal is to win one of the 3 Grand Slams that remain this year: Alcaraz
243.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz said winning one of the remaining three Grand Slams of 2022 is his goal this year, adding he's hopeful to do it at upcoming French Open. "It's a great motivation for me [to win a Slam] and I'll fight for it," he added. The 19-year-old recently won his fourth title of 2022 at Madrid Open.

244.title: It's always special: Djokovic on his matches vs Nadal at Italian Open
244.article_body:
World number one Novak Djokovic said his matches against 10-time champion Rafael Nadal at Italian Open have always been special. "We've played so many years...so many matchups on this surface than any other surface," he added. Nadal and Djokovic are slated to meet in semi-finals. 
Djokovic has won only three of his nine matches against Nadal in Rome.

245.title: 25-yr-old woman patient raped by sweeper in UP hospital
245.article_body: A 25-year-old woman patient was allegedly raped by a sweeper on May 7 in UP’s Mirzapur divisional hospital when she had gone to the washroom. The woman informed her husband about the incident, following which the matter was reported to the police on Tuesday. Mirzapur ASP Sanjay Kumar said that three teams have been formed to arrest the accused.

246.title: US removes 'Taiwan is part of China' reference from State Dept site, China reacts
246.article_body: US State Department website's section on Taiwan has removed reference to Taiwan being part of China. The updated text calls Taiwan "a leading democracy". Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Zhao Lijian said there's only one China, Taiwan belongs to China, and People's Republic of China is the sole legal government representing the whole country, further calling US' move "a petty act".

247.title: Centre ruined country's economy: Congress leader Sachin Pilot
247.article_body: After the Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday, Congress leader Sachin Pilot said the Centre has ruined the country's economy. Pilot said, "The tenure of...Centre on the economic issues of...[India] is full of failures." Pilot said the BJP has put the country in economic crisis with inflation, unemployment and economic mismanagement.

248.title: Saddening to see no relief provided to post-poll victims: WB Guv
248.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday said that it's saddening that those who lost their properties after the post-poll violence in the state last year still haven't received compensation. "The memorandum demands financial compensation for all families whose properties got destructed. I will study this memorandum as administration should be unbiased," he added.

249.title: '83' made around ₹200 cr amid 3rd wave, which isn't bad: Ranveer Singh
249.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh revealed that his film '83' was criticised by the trade for not making as much money as it was projected to make. However, he added, "The film still made around ₹200 crore in the middle of the third wave which is not bad at all." "It was just a case of unfortunate timing," he added.

250.title: I stood up for Aishwarya when media fat-shamed her: Raveena
250.article_body: Actress Raveena Tandon has recalled standing up for Aishwarya Rai saying she just had a baby when the media fat-shamed her. Raveena added, "A journalist said, 'Arrey Raveena ji, you have become so fat. You used to be 'mast cheez' and are now doing reality shows.' I told him, 'My fat will go away but how will your face change?'"

251.title: Bihar college principal, lecturers among 4 arrested for BPSC paper leak
251.article_body: Four people have been arrested in connection with the leak of the Bihar Public Service Commission's question papers for civil services (preliminary) examinations. The arrested persons include a principal of the college where the leak occurred, two lecturers and Barhara BDO Jai Vardhan Gupta. BPSC had cancelled the exam after the paper was leaked right before the exam on Sunday.

252.title: Andhra CM's cousin arrested in extortion case, CM says 'no one will be spared'
252.article_body: YSRCP leader and cousin of Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy, YS Konda Reddy, was arrested on Tuesday in an alleged extortion case. The accused had allegedly demanded bribe from a construction company's owners for allowing them to continue their project in Chakrayapet Mandal. CM Reddy, while ordering a probe into the case, said no one will be spared.

253.title: Swiggy suspends Supr Daily operations in 5 cities including Delhi, Mumbai
253.article_body: Swiggy is suspending its subscription-based fresh groceries service Supr Daily's operations in five cities, namely Delhi-NCR, Mumbai, Pune, Hyderabad and Chennai. Swiggy will continue to serve its users in Bengaluru and "double down" on its efforts there. "We, unfortunately, are yet to demonstrate a clear path to profitability," Supr Daily CEO Phani Kishan Addepalli's e-mail to employees read.

254.title: 'Yellow brick road' found at the bottom of Pacific Ocean, footage released
254.article_body: A team of researchers discovered what looked like a yellow brick road at the bottom of the Pacific Ocean last month. Footage from the expedition showed the path which appeared to be paved with cobblestones and the researchers are heard describing it as "bizarre". One of the researchers is heard calling it "the road to Atlantis".

255.title: Never too old: Omar after ex-H'yana CM Chautala passes Class 10 &12 at 87
255.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and NC leader Omar Abdullah on Tuesday praised former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala after the latter passed Class 10 and 12 at the age of 87 on Tuesday. "A person is never too old to learn. Congratulations Chautala (sahib)," Abdullah tweeted. Haryana Education Board officials handed over the marksheets to Chautala in Chandigarh today.

256.title: Dismiss Jairam Thakur govt over HP's deteriorating law & order: AAP to Guv
256.article_body: AAP on Tuesday asked Himachal Pradesh Governor RV Arlekar to dismiss the Jairam Thakur-led government over "deteriorating" law and order in Himachal Pradesh. Earlier, AAP held a demonstration outside the Shimla Deputy Commissioner's office for the same reason. This comes after Khalistani flags were tied to the main gate and boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly.

257.title: Amit Shah inaugurates Assam govt's monthly newsletter 'Asom Barta'
257.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah inaugurated the Assam government's monthly newsletter 'Asom Barta' in Guwahati on Tuesday. "The newsletter will enable citizens to stay connected with the government and its policies," its editor Bishnu Kamal Bora said. It will be printed in Assamese, English, and Hindi initially and in Bengali and other regional languages of Assam later on, he added.

258.title: Karnataka IPS officer Ravindranath resigns for 4th time, cites 'harassment'
258.article_body: IPS officer P Ravindranath on Tuesday submitted his resignation from the police force for the fourth time in his career, citing "harassment". "I'm prematurely transferred without any public interest...since I've taken legal action against people involved in the fake caste certificate issue," he said in a letter. "I'm pained to observe the apathy shown by state Chief Secretary," Ravindranath added.

259.title: Checkpoints set up to stop Rajapaksa supporters from fleeing Sri Lanka
259.article_body: Anti-government protesters in Colombo have set up checkpoints on a road leading to city's airport in a bid to prevent supporters of ex-PM Mahinda Rajapaksa from leaving Sri Lanka amid the ongoing economic crisis. The move comes a day after violent clashes erupted between pro and anti-government protesters, claiming at least eight lives. Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned as PM on Monday.

260.title: Had tanks around us in Afghanistan during Khuda Gawah shoot: Producer
260.article_body: Producer Manoj Desai recalled filming Amitabh Bachchan-starrer 'Khuda Gawah' in Afghanistan. Manoj said the then-president Mohammad Najibullah aired only old films of Amitabh and Sridevi on television. "Najibullah...was so honoured to have these stars...Whenever [we went there] to shoot, we had 4-5 tanks in front and 4-5 tanks behind us," he stated, adding they had a unit of 200 people.

261.title: CBI raids 8 places in Jammu, Srinagar, Mumbai in J&K Bank scam case
261.article_body: The CBI on Tuesday searched eight locations in Jammu, Srinagar and Mumbai in connection with alleged irregularities in purchase of a building by J&K Bank in Mumbai in 2010, officials said. They added that this included searching the premises of then J&K Bank Chairman Haseeb Drabu. In April, the ED questioned former J&K CM Omar Abdullah in the same case.

262.title: Delhi sees 1,118 new COVID-19 cases & 1 death, positivity rate at 4.38%
262.article_body: Delhi on Tuesday reported 1,118 new COVID-19 cases as compared to 799 cases recorded on Monday. One person died due to COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, while the positivity rate stood at 4.38% as compared to 4.94% reported on Monday. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the national capital rose to 5,471 from 5,369 reported on Monday.

263.title: I gave up acting at one point: Mrunal Thakur on 10 years of acting
263.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, speaking about 10 years of her acting career, stated that at one point she felt like it was not working out and gave up acting. She added that she travelled to Indonesia and lived there for six months. "('Love Sonia') broke the stereotype [of my television actress image]...'Love Sonia' was my ticket to Bollywood," the actress said.

264.title: 9 pilots, 32 cabin staff failed pre-flight alcohol tests in last 4 months: DGCA
264.article_body: A total of nine pilots and 32 cabin crew members failed the pre-flight alcohol tests this year, DGCA said on Tuesday. Of these, two pilots and two cabin crew members were suspended for three years after being found positive during the breath analyser test for the second time, it added. The remaining 37 people were suspended for three months.

265.title: Their misfortune: Javed Ali on Lata not being mentioned at Oscars, Grammys
265.article_body: Singer Javed Ali has commented on late veteran singer Lata Mangeshkar not being paid a tribute at the 2022 Oscars and Grammys, saying that it is their misfortune. "If they would have given it to her the award would have become much bigger. She was an award in herself," Javed added. Lata passed away on February 6 after battling COVID-19.

266.title: Sri Lanka issues shoot-on-sight orders amid riots
266.article_body: Amid an economic crisis in the country, the Sri Lankan Defence Ministry ordered its Armed Forces to open fire at anyone looting public property or causing harm to others. This comes after a day of clashes left several people dead and injured more than 200. Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa had resigned amid the economic crisis.

267.title: Sri Lankan Prez urges for peace as death toll due to clashes rises to 8
267.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Tuesday urged people to "stop violence and acts of revenge" against citizens as death toll due to recent clashes rose to eight. He added that efforts will be made to restore political stability amid economic crisis. Nearly 250 people were injured after clashes between pro and anti-government protesters broke out in Colombo on Monday.

268.title: GT will be 1st team to qualify for playoffs in IPL 2022: Harbhajan
268.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has said that GT are going to beat LSG and become the first team to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs. "Hardik Pandya-led side is very strong. Rashid Khan is in great form...coach Ashish Nehra is giving them just the right amount of confidence," he stated. Both teams have eight wins each so far.

269.title: Ex-Andhra CM Chandrababu Naidu, others booked by CID over 'corrupt activities'
269.article_body: The CID has booked former Andhra Pradesh CM N Chandrababu Naidu and other private individuals and firms over irregularities in the construction of an internal ring road in Amaravati. The complainant in the case, YSR Congress Party MLA ARK Reddy, has alleged certain "illegal and corrupt activities" were committed by government officials between 2014 and 2019 in connection with construction.

270.title: Anonymous donor clears $300,000 debt of over 100 US college students
270.article_body: An anonymous donor has cleared the debt of over 100 students of Wiley College in US' Texas, college authorities said. The announcement that the debt worth $300,000 (around ₹2.31 crore) was cleared, was made during their convocation. A clip shared by the college showed the students cheering after being told that they were debt-free and didn't owe the college anything.

271.title: 31-yr-old ex-NBA player Adreian Payne shot dead, police release pic of suspect
271.article_body: Ex-NBA player Adreian Payne was shot dead in a Florida townhouse on Monday. Police were called to the scene of the shooting in Orlando at around 1.30 am, following which the 31-year-old was rushed to the hospital, where he was declared dead. Police have released the picture of a suspect, 29-year-old Lawrence Dority, who was arrested and charged with murder.

272.title: Punjab govt not serious about border security: Union Minister
272.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat criticised the AAP government in Punjab over the blast in Mohali, saying that the state government is "not serious about border security". Terming the blast as "unfortunate", Shekhawat said, "Punjab is a border area with sensitive boundaries." There is a need for more vigilance and the state government needs to make serious efforts, he added.

273.title: Nepal bowler Sita Rana Magar does viral 'Pushpa' celebration after taking wicket
273.article_body: Nepal's bowler Sita Rana Magar moved her hand under the chin, mimicking actor Allu Arjun's style in the movie 'Pushpa', to celebrate after taking a wicket. She did the viral 'Pushpa' celebration in a match between Tornadoes Women and Sapphires Women at the Fairbreak Invitational Women's T20 2022 tournament in Dubai. ICC's official Instagram account shared Magar's 'Pushpa' celebration video.

274.title: SP MLA Azam Khan gets interim bail in land grab case, another case pending
274.article_body: The Allahabad High Court on Tuesday granted interim bail to Samajwadi Party MLA Azam Khan in a land grabbing case. However, he will continue to stay in jail for another pending case. There are a total of 88 cases registered against Khan and he has been granted bail in 87 of these cases.

275.title: Zomato's market cap falls below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion
275.article_body: Zomato's market capitalisation fell below its last private valuation of $5.4 billion on Tuesday after the food delivery platform's shares hit a new all-time low. Zomato's shares fell 7.22% on Tuesday to end at ₹52.65 on the NSE, giving it a market capitalisation of about $5.3 billion. Notably, Zomato's rival Swiggy was valued at $10.7 billion earlier this year.

276.title: Canara Bank detects frauds worth ₹3.9 cr in internal probe: Report
276.article_body: State-led Canara Bank is investigating fraud in its housing finance unit Can Fin Homes after a whistleblower alleged irregularities in certain accounts, Reuters reported quoting a source. The bank has detected frauds in 37 accounts worth ₹3.9 crore, the source said. They added that fake income tax return documents had been submitted for these accounts.

277.title: Malaysia may cut palm oil export tax by half: Report
277.article_body: The Commodities Ministry of the world's second-largest palm oil producer Malaysia has proposed to cut the export tax on the oil by half amid a global edible oil shortage. Malaysia's Plantation Industries and Commodities Minister Zuraida Kamaruddin told Reuters that the country could temporarily cut the tax from 8% to 4%-6%. Recently, top global producer Indonesia banned palm oil exports.

278.title: Chinese Prez Xi Jinping suffering from cerebral aneurysm, was hospitalised: Reports
278.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping is suffering from cerebral aneurysm and had to be hospitalised at the end of 2021, reports said. He reportedly preferred to be treated with traditional Chinese medicines rather than going for surgery. There have been speculations about Xi's health as he had avoided meeting foreign leaders since COVID-19 outbreak till the Beijing Winter Olympics.

279.title: Thanks Ridhi Dogra for the idea of a jail: Ekta Kapoor on 'Lock Upp'
279.article_body: 'Lock Upp' producer Ekta Kapoor took to Instagram and wrote, "Thanks Ridhi for the idea of a jail when I wanted to be different in the reality space!" She further thanked the show's host Kangana Ranaut and wrote, "Thank you, Kangana for supporting an Indian concept...and doing a fantastic job!" Comedian Munawar Faruqui won the first season.

280.title: 5 Indian startups among 100 joining WEF's Tech Pioneers 2022
280.article_body: Five Indian startups are among the 100 startups that have joined World Economic Forum's Technology Pioneers 2022. These include Vahan, which is building a full-stack labour marketplace for blue-collar workers and SmartCoin Financials, a tech-driven financial inclusion platform. The other three are waste commerce firm Recykal, plant protein startup Proeon and freight management platform Pandocorp.

281.title: India enter 2022 Uber Cup knockouts after 4-1 win over USA
281.article_body: India entered the knockout stage of 2022 Uber Cup Finals after defeating USA 4-1 in their Group D tie in Bangkok on Tuesday. While world number seven PV Sindhu, Aakarshi Kashyap, Ashmita Chaliha and doubles duo of Tanisha Crasto and Treesa Jolly won their respective matches, the doubles pair of Ritika Thaker and Simran Singhi lost their match.

282.title: Questioned in theft case, woman kills self in Kanpur shelter home
282.article_body: A 32-year-old woman from Unnao allegedly died by suicide in a shelter home in Kanpur after the police questioned her and her minor daughter in a theft case. After the death, her relatives reached the mortuary and staged a protest. "We are planning to conduct an inquiry to get all the facts in the case," Kanpur DCP BBGTS Murthy said.

283.title: Maharashtra announces state funeral for Pandit Shivkumar Sharma
283.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a state funeral for santoor maestro Padma Vibhushan Pandit Shivkumar Sharma who passed away after a cardiac failure on Tuesday. His funeral will be held at the Vile Parle Hindu cremation ground near the Juhu airport in Mumbai on Wednesday. The mortal remains will be kept at his home from 10 am to 1 pm.

284.title: GT to bat first against LSG in top-of-the-table clash, make 3 changes to playing XI
284.article_body: Second-placed GT captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bat first against first-placed LSG. GT have made three changes to their playing XI, with Matthew Wade, Sai Kishore and Yash Dayal replacing Lockie Ferguson, Sai Sudharsan and Pradeep Sangwan. Karan Sharma has replaced Ravi Bishnoi in LSG's playing XI.

285.title: Tesla recalls 1.3 lakh vehicles in US over display malfunction
285.article_body: Tesla is recalling about 1.3 lakh vehicles in the US following an overheating issue that may cause the center touchscreen display to malfunction, the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration said. The recall includes Tesla's 2021-2022 models S and X and its 3 and Y models from 2022. No crashes or injuries have been reported due to the issue, Tesla said.

286.title: 3 killed, 20 injured after mini-truck falls off culvert in MP
286.article_body: At least three people were killed and 20 others were injured after a mini-truck fell off a culvert in Madhya Pradesh's Alirajpur. Police said the victims were going to attend a wedding in Chandra Shekhar Azad Nagar. The injured were admitted to the district hospital for treatment, officials said. Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan expressed grief over the incident.

287.title: Civilian dead, 2 injured in firing by terrorists trying to escape in J&K
287.article_body: A civilian was killed and two others, including a soldier, sustained injuries after two terrorists allegedly fired at them in a bid to escape after they were intercepted near Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian, an Army spokesperson said. The injured persons were airlifted to a hospital in Srinagar. The conditions of the soldier and another civilian are said to be stable.

288.title: Food delivery workers in Dubai go on strike to protest against less pay
288.article_body: Food delivery workers contracted by Talabat in Dubai staged a mass walk-out on Monday to protest against meager pay and inadequate protections at work. The strike comes days after foreign contract workers associated with another food delivery company compelled them to suspend plans to deduct employees' earnings amid surging fuel prices. Notably, strikes and labour unions are illegal in UAE.

289.title: Layout of 'world's first Bitcoin City' in El Salvador unveiled, President shares pics
289.article_body: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele has shared the layout of the 'world's first Bitcoin City' that will initially be funded by Bitcoin-backed bonds. Bukele shared on Twitter pictures of a gold-coloured 3D model and rendered images of the city. 'Bitcoin City' will be constructed at the foot of a volcano which is being used to mine Bitcoin using geothermal energy.

290.title: Ex-Andhra Pradesh minister P Narayana arrested in Class 10 paper leak case
290.article_body: Narayana Group of Educational Institutions Founder and former Andhra Pradesh minister P Narayana was arrested by CID officials on Tuesday in connection with a Class 10 exam paper leak case. Nine persons, including government school employees, have been arrested in the case. CID officials arrested Narayana from his residence at Kondapur in Hyderabad.

291.title: Home delivery of liquor may soon be a reality in Delhi
291.article_body: The Delhi excise department has proposed that the Delhi government legalise the home delivery of liquor and stop regulating discounts offered by vendors in the Delhi Excise Policy 2022-23, according to officials. According to the 2021 rules, shops with an L-13 licence may deliver liquor to private homes, but only if the order is received through a mobile app.

292.title: What is Rocket-Propelled Grenade, weapon reportedly used in Mohali blast?
292.article_body: A Rocket-Propelled Grenade (RPG) was reportedly used in Monday's blast at Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali. The RPG is a portable, shoulder-fired weapon of Soviet origin and experts believe an RPG PG-22 Netto version was used in Mohali. RPG PG-22 Netto has a front-loading tube from which it is fired and has a range of up to 250 meters.

293.title: Russians accidentally kill own troops with flamethrowers, Ukraine thanks them
293.article_body: Russian soldiers on Sunday targeted their own troops with flamethrowers in Ukraine's Zaporizhzhya, killing many of them, Ukraine's military said. Thanking the Russians for the friendly fire incident, Ukraine's 97th Infantry Battalion expressed "satisfaction with actions of the Russian occupiers". "Such actions are positively perceived, supported in every way by the Ukrainian military," it added.

294.title: I also whistled watching Yash's intro scene in 'KGF 2': Sanjay Dutt
294.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt revealed he also whistled during Yash's introduction scene in 'KGF: Chapter 2'. Speaking about the importance of such introduction scenes, he said, "It's a very important part of cinema. I mean, part of cinema where we guys have grown up." "We used to see Amitabh Bachchan in Sholay or in Zanjeer, it was a high," he added.

295.title: Former Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala passes class 10 & 12 at 87, pic surfaces
295.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Om Prakash Chautala on Tuesday passed Class 10 and 12 at the age of 87. Haryana Education Board officials handed over the marksheets to him in Chandigarh today. Chautala had enrolled in Class 12, however, his result was withheld because he had not yet passed Class 10 English exam.

296.title: Army chief Gen Manoj Pande receives Param Vishisht Seva Medal from Prez
296.article_body: Newly-appointed Army chief General Manoj Pande received the Param Vishisht Seva Medal from President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday. The medal is awarded to all ranks of the Indian Armed Forces to recognise exceptional peace-time service. The gallantry awards ceremony was held at Rashtrapati Bhavan in Delhi today.

297.title: He was fearless: Danish Siddiqui's father as he wins 2nd Pulitzer
297.article_body: After slain photojournalist Danish Siddiqui won his second Pulitzer Prize, his father said he faced all kinds of pressures but he was fearless. Siddiqui was killed last year while covering a clash between Afghan security forces and Taliban forces. His father Mohammad Akhtar Siddiqui said he was a workaholic and was extremely professionally committed.

298.title: Prez Kovind condoles demise of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma
298.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind on Tuesday condoled the death of Santoor maestro Pandit Shivkumar Sharma and said, "[His] recitals would leave connoisseurs of Indian classical music spellbound." President Kovind added, "Sad to learn that his Santoor is now silenced. Condolences to his family." Pandit Shivkumar Sharma passed away due to cardiac arrest at the age of 84 on Tuesday.

299.title: Hyderabad City Police arrest rowdy sheeter, recover 20 kg ganja
299.article_body: The Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday arrested a rowdy sheeter and recovered over 20 kilograms of ganja and a dagger knife from his possession. According to the police, the man had hidden the ganja in a plastic gunny bag, containing 10 wrap packs of ganja. He was involved in 34 criminal cases, including murder, robbery, kidnapping and extortion, police said.

300.title: Didn't attend a wedding in 8yrs of 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii': Sakshi
300.article_body: Actress Sakshi Tanwar has revealed in an interview that she didn't attend any weddings during the eight years of her television show 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii' because she wouldn't get the time. She further said that she's now in a phase where work is only a part of her life so she can be with her daughter and her family.

301.title: JD(U) leader urges Bihar CM to save his family from his wife, Naxal commander
301.article_body: JD(U) leader Awadesh Lal Dev has requested Bihar CM Nitish Kumar to save his and his family members' lives from a Naxal group active in Darbhanga. Awadesh claimed that his wife has links with Naxal commander Manoj Laldev, who is threatening to kill his entire family. "On April 23, Manoj along with 50-60 Naxals arrived at my house," he added.

302.title: I can't open my mouth in front of her: Manoj Pahwa on wife Seema
302.article_body: Actor Manoj Pahwa has revealed that he can't open his mouth in front of his wife actress Seema Pahwa. He added that she is a senior actor and can make him feel grounded in a second. Manoj further said that his family is full of critics and Seema has criticised his "terrible acting", saying that he could've done better.

303.title: 2 use forged tickets to enter Pune Airport to see off classmate
303.article_body: Two college students were booked for entering the Pune International Airport using a forged screenshot of an air ticket to see off a classmate who was leaving for Jaipur. The BCom students were caught by the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) while leaving the airport, officers said. The youths are yet to be arrested, police said.

304.title: We outplayed MI in all 3 departments: Shreyas on KKR's 52-run win
304.article_body: Following KKR's 52-run win over MI in IPL, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer said his side outplayed the five-time champions in all three departments. "Let's try to gauge what we did really well...let it get into your mind so that we can keep repeating this thing again and again," he added. Chasing 166, MI were all-out for 113 in 17.3 overs.

305.title: Ran out of money during lockdown, in theatre you earn ₹2,000: Sarika
305.article_body: Actress Sarika said that she ran out of money during the COVID-19 pandemic and added that she returned to acting as working in theatre during her acting break earned her ₹2,000-2,700. Talking about the break, Sarika said, "It was a very conscious decision... I thought it would be for a year but it turned out to be five years."

306.title: There's no cut footage of Cruise in 'Doctor Strange 2': Screenwriter
306.article_body: 'Doctor Strange in the Multiverse of Madness' screenwriter Michael Waldron said Tom Cruise was considered to be part of the film, however, it never happened due to Cruise's availability. He stated Cruise was shooting for Mission Impossible 7 and 8. Adding that the fan theories were made up, he said, "I mean there's no cut footage of Tom Cruise!"

307.title: Johnny Depp is possessed by pirate demons: Pastor Bob Larson
307.article_body: Evangelist and self-proclaimed exorcist Pastor Bob Larson has claimed that actor Johnny Depp has been possessed by "pirate demons". He said, "I wonder, did Depp get actual pirate demons from playing his Jack Sparrow role [in 'Pirates of the Caribbean']?" This comes amid Depp's defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard over her op-ed claiming to be a domestic abuse survivor.

308.title: Bombay HC refuses to let teen rape victim abort 29-week pregnancy
308.article_body: Bombay HC has denied permission to a 16-year-old rape survivor to terminate her 29-week pregnancy and has directed the Maharashtra government to pay the survivor an interim compensation of ₹50,000. The HC refused permission as a team of doctors opined that if the pregnancy was terminated at this stage, the baby would be born prematurely and suffer from lifelong morbidities.

309.title: Pune civic body plans to charge vehicles for parking on major roads
309.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation is planning to implement a policy under which vehicles will be charged for parking on major city roads. The parking policy was approved by the standing committee in 2018 but did not have a political consensus, a civic official said. He added that PMC will finalise the strategy after discussing it with the police.

310.title: Rahul Dravid not to attend BJP event in Himachal Pradesh, says 'reports incorrect'
310.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has refuted media reports which claimed that he would be participating in BJP Yuva Morcha's National Working Committee session in Dharamshala. "A section of the media has reported that I will attend a meeting in Himachal Pradesh from May 12-15. I wish to clarify that the said report is incorrect," Dravid told ANI.

311.title: Assam tackling illegal migration strongly, Bengal isn't: Amit Shah
311.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah praised Assam for tackling illegal migration strongly while alleging that Bengal hadn't cooperated with the Centre on the same issue. Reacting to Shah's remarks, TMC called them "baseless", adding that it's Border Security Force's (BSF) duty to curb cross-border infiltration. Bengal government has extended all support to Centre on this issue, a TMC leader said.

312.title: Hyderabad Police stops child marriage, rescues minor girl
312.article_body: The She Team of Rachakonda Police averted a child marriage in the Chikatimamidi area and rescued a minor girl. The police also counselled the elders and briefed them about the demerits of child marriage. Last month, Rachakonda Police Commissioner Mahesh M Bhagwat had said that parents, priests, wedding invitation printers, elders and supporters of child marriage will be held responsible.

313.title: Groom shoots guest after argument over music during wedding in UP
313.article_body: A guest at a wedding was shot dead by the groom following an argument over the playing of songs in UP's Muzaffarnagar, police said on Tuesday. Both the groom and the bride's side clashed during the wedding procession as some of them objected to the playing of songs by the DJ, Additional Superintendent of Police (rural) Atul Srivastava said.

314.title: How can PBKS, who have the 2nd worst NRR, still qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
314.article_body: PBKS are currently placed eighth on IPL 2022 points table with 10 points. PBKS currently have the second-worst net run-rate (NRR) of -0.231. PBKS would need to win their remaining three matches (against RCB, DC and SRH) with huge margins to get to 16 points and better their NRR. They'd also want RR and RCB to lose their remaining matches.

315.title: IAS officer said 'strong winds' led to Bihar bridge collapse, I was amazed: Gadkari
315.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Monday said he was "amazed" when his secretary, an IAS officer, told him that a portion of an under-construction bridge in Bihar had collapsed due to "strong winds". Gadkari added, "I fail to understand how a bridge collapsed due to strong winds." The minister also said, "There must be something wrong with the structure."

316.title: You have many questions: Debina on trolling for holding baby 'carelessly'
316.article_body: Television actress Debina Bonnerjee has responded to social media users who trolled her for holding her baby "carelessly" in a video she shared. The actress wrote on Instagram Stories, "So many questions you have!! Why I hold my baby a certain way...All I say is I am surrounded by...protective hands as you can see who say it's all fine."

317.title: Indonesian President plans to meet Musk over nickel supply
317.article_body: Indonesian President Joko Widodo is planning to meet Tesla CEO Elon Musk during a US visit this week, the country's Coordinating Minister Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan said. He added that Musk's representatives were currently in Indonesia and due to visit the nickel production hub of Morowali. Indonesia wants to enter the global supply chain of the EV industry, Luhut said previously.

318.title: German antitrust body's data curb order 'clearly flawed': Meta
318.article_body: Meta on Tuesday said German antitrust watchdog's order to curb Facebook's data collection is "clearly flawed". The order, passed in 2019, said Facebook had abused its market power by collecting users' data without their consent and ordered it to stop. Meta also criticised the German watchdog for not cooperating with the Irish data protection regulator which supervises Facebook.

319.title: I'll make sure that citizens' complaints are addressed: New BBMP chief
319.article_body: The new Chief Commissioner of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), Tushar Giri Nath, has said that he will make sure that citizens' complaints are addressed. He said that monsoon preparedness, preventing the spread of COVID-19 and enhancement of infrastructure are his top priorities. He added that BESCOM and BWSSB should work in coordination and respond to citizens' woes immediately.

320.title: Canada, US' electric aircraft firms want to manufacture in India: Scindia
320.article_body: Several electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) companies from the US and Canada are interested in setting up units in India, Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. He added that eVTOL aircrafts are currently being used by the defence forces of the two countries. An e-VTOL aircraft uses electric power to hover, take off and land vertically.

321.title: Ranveer's 'Jayeshbhai...' cleared for release, court orders new disclaimers to be added
321.article_body: Delhi High Court has cleared Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' for theatrical release on May 13, asking the producers to add new disclaimers. It was hearing a petition that sought removal of a scene involving pre-natal sex determination test. Earlier, the court had demanded a screening, asking producers to show them the relevant scene or face a stay on the release.

322.title: 60 fishermen escape unhurt as their boats capsize off Odisha coast
322.article_body: A group of 60 fishermen had a narrow escape after their boats capsized off Odisha coast in Ganjam due to high tide in the wake of Cyclone Asani. All the fishermen managed to swim to the shore. In the wake of the cyclone, fishermen were advised not to venture into the sea along and off Odisha coast till May 13.

323.title: AAP govt harmful to Punjab's security: Congress' Jaiveer Shergill
323.article_body: Congress leader Jaiveer Shergill criticised the AAP government in Punjab, calling it "harmful" to the state's security a day after a rocket-propelled grenade hit Punjab Police's intelligence wing headquarters in Mohali. He requested Home Minister Amit Shah to get central agencies to probe the incident. "Attack on Police office in Mohali should serve as an alarm...for administration!" he tweeted.

324.title: Class 12 student in Andhra dies while waiting outside exam centre
324.article_body: A 17-year-old class 12 student, Satish, collapsed and died outside the examination centre in Andhra Pradesh's Guduru on Tuesday. A resident of Kammavaripalli village, Satish has been travelling to the town daily to appear in the annual examinations. He suddenly started sweating and collapsed on ground while waiting outside the centre. Doctors suspect he might have suffered cardiac arrest.

325.title: G7's concern over Hong Kong leader's selection is interference: China
325.article_body: China said on Tuesday that G7 countries' concern over the selection of Hong Kong's new chief executive was interference in China's internal affairs. This comes after G7 nations said that selection criteria for the post underscored worries about fundamental freedoms in Hong Kong. John Lee was elected as Hong Kong's new leader by a largely pro-Beijing committee on Sunday.

326.title: Kannada singer falls into open drain with 'chest-deep water' in B'luru, criticises BBMP
326.article_body: Kannada singer Ajay Warrier has claimed that he sustained several stitches and multiple bruises on his leg after he fell into an open drain in Bengaluru. "The water was up to my chest," he said. While criticising the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike, Warrier added, "As a...tax-paying citizen of Bengaluru, I'm here to spread this message as a public safety warning."

327.title: Carlos Alcaraz is undoubtedly the best player in the world: Djokovic
327.article_body: Novak Djokovic said Spain's Carlos Alcaraz has been undoubtedly the world's best player so far this year. "At Roland Garros, he is...one of the...favourites...though he's never reached the second week of a Grand Slam," added Djokovic. Alcaraz recently became the first player to beat both Djokovic and Rafael Nadal in the same clay court tournament, during the Madrid Open.

328.title: Ex-village head held for threatening Dalits from entering his field in UP
328.article_body: A former village head was arrested for allegedly threatening the members of the Dalit community from entering his field in Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar district. Furious after some Dalit members refused to work in his field, the accused, identified as Rajbir Tyagi, announced that Dalit members would be beaten with shoes 50 times if they tried to enter the field.

329.title: Lack of oxygen likely led to fish deaths at Banganga Tank: BMC
329.article_body: A probe by Mumbai's civic body BMC revealed that a severe oxygen deficiency in the city's historic Banganga Tank could have led to the death of thousands of fish. The report comes 20 days after several fish were found belly up in the tank. The water's colour had turned light green due to the presence of toxic components, it said.

330.title: SC asks Centre if sedition law can be put on hold till review, wants reply tomorrow
330.article_body: Supreme Court on Tuesday asked Centre to reply by tomorrow on whether the sedition law can be paused while the law is being reviewed. "In order to protect the interest of people who are already booked as well as future cases, Centre to file response on whether those can be kept in abeyance till law is re-examined," the court said.

331.title: Jodie Comer to star in Benedict Cumberbatch-backed apocalyptic thriller
331.article_body: Jodie Comer, who recently won the Leading Actress award at the BAFTA TV Awards, has bagged an apocalyptic thriller, 'The End We Start From'. Mahalia Belo has been roped in to direct the film, while Benedict Cumberbatch is attached to the project as executive producer. It is an adaptation of the 2017 novel of the same name by Megan Hunter.

332.title: Anupam hosts 'Fauda' actor Tsahi Halevi at his acting institute, shares video
332.article_body: Anupam Kher hosted Israeli actor Tsahi Halevi, who starred in the spy series 'Fauda', at his acting institute 'Anupam Kher's Actor Prepares' in Mumbai. Taking to Twitter on Monday, Anupam shared a video in which Tsahi could be seen singing 'Tere Jaisa Yaar' at the diploma ceremony of the institute. "We loved the song! Thank you for...warm visit," Anupam wrote.

333.title: Govt aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030: Scindia
333.article_body: Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia has said the government is aiming to make India a global drone hub by 2030. Addressing the 'Experience Studio on Drones' event organised by NITI Aayog, Scindia said the drone industry has a huge potential and can lead to 10,000 jobs. He added India would need nearly a lakh drone pilots in the coming years.

334.title: Always listen to your wife: Pune Police chief to man planning to relocate
334.article_body: Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta replied to over 35 questions during a question and answer session on Twitter on Monday. When a man from Mumbai asked him whether he should relocate to Bengaluru or Pune, which his wife prefers, Gupta replied, "Both are lovely cities, but the rule book says 'Always listen to your wife!'"

335.title: Manipur Police arrest Mumbai BPO employee for post on tribal chief
335.article_body: A 38-year-old resident of Mumbai's Mira Road, Pau Lian Kap, was arrested by Manipur Police after he posted about the death of tribal chief Raja Goukhothang Guite on social media. Kap was arrested after a complaint by the chairperson of the Raja Goukhothang Guite 150th Death Commemoration Committee, reports say. The complaint said that the post promoted enmity between communities.

336.title: Nitin Gadkari inaugurates pothole repair machine in Delhi
336.article_body: Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari on Monday inaugurated a pothole repair machine developed by Central Road Research Institute (CRRI). The unique mobile cold mixer cum paver and patch-fill machine can repair 12-15 medium-sized potholes within one hour, officials said. The machines cost ₹30 lakh per unit compared to imported machines that cost ₹2 crore.

337.title: We need to revitalise world economy in inclusive ways: Raghuram Rajan
337.article_body: Ex-RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said that in order to raise investment and productivity, the need is to revitalise global growth in inclusive ways. In an article published in Financial Times, Rajan said, "The easiest solution economically, and the hardest politically, is to reverse the trend to deglobalisation." Developing countries' public spending has been constrained in the pandemic, he added.

338.title: Calling Marvel films 'lesser art' disrespectful to crew: Elizabeth
338.article_body: Actress Elizabeth Olsen, who portrays Scarlet Witch in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, has stated that criticising Marvel films as a "lesser type of art" takes away from "the hundreds of very talented crew people". She further said diminishing them with that kind of criticism takes away from all the people who do award-winning films and also work on these projects.

339.title: BJP, Congress want to 'finish off' JD(S): Former K'taka CM Kumaraswamy
339.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Tuesday alleged that both BJP and the Congress are luring his party leaders from old Mysuru region. "Their main agenda is to finish off JD(S) and are competing for it," he said, adding that 'true' JD(S) supporters and workers will not abandon the party. "If this regional party remains...this state has future," Kumaraswamy added.

340.title: MP Navneet Rana harassed because she is a Dalit: Ramdas Athawale
340.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale has alleged that MP Navneet Rana and her husband MLA Ravi Rana are facing injustice because of her being a Dalit. "I have always supported Navneet because a great injustice has been done to her by the Maharashtra government," Athawale said. "Sedition should not be imposed in the name of reading Hanuman Chalisa," he added.

341.title: PM Modi replicating Gujarat model across India: Rahul Gandhi
341.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused Prime Minister Narendra Modi of replicating Gujarat model across India and said, "As the Prime Minister, Modi is doing in country what he did as the chief minister in Gujarat - creating one India for rich and another for common people." Resources of the country are being given away to...few wealthy people, he added.

342.title: 20 died within 6 days of onset of Char Dham Yatra 2022: U'khand govt
342.article_body: As many as 20 people have died within six days of the onset of Char Dham Yatra, the Uttarakhand Health Department confirmed. Most of these deaths have occurred due to cardiac-related issues and altitude sickness, it said. While 14 passengers died in Yamunotri and Gangotri Dham, five devotees died in Kedarnath and one in Badrinath Dham, as per government record.

343.title: Delhi's Mathura Road to be traffic signal-free, to get 4 U-turn underpasses
343.article_body: In a bid to end traffic jams and make travel between central and south Delhi easier, Delhi's Mathura Road stretch will be made traffic signal-free. Public Works Department will remove all five traffic signals on the stretch. Meanwhile, four U-turn underpasses will be provided for smooth travel. Officials said this will be part of ongoing Pragati Maidan corridor redevelopment project.

344.title: Russia's Rutube remains offline for 2nd day, says, 'Hit with biggest cyberattack'
344.article_body: Russia's video platform Rutube remained offline for a second consecutive day on Tuesday after it was hit by a cyberattack just before it was about to stream the Victory Day parade in Moscow on Monday. "We have, in fact, been hit with the biggest cyberattack in Rutube's history," the platform said in a message on Telegram on Tuesday.

345.title: Permission required to use loudspeakers over next 15 days: Karnataka govt
345.article_body: Following Karnataka CM BS Bommai's meeting with state Home Department officials, the state government announced that permission would be required to use loudspeakers in the state over the next 15 days. According to the state government, those who haven't obtained permission should voluntarily remove the loudspeakers. A committee would be formed to decide on the application for use of loudspeakers.

346.title: When I was small, I would always keep the light on: Rafael Nadal
346.article_body: Rafael Nadal said he would always keep the light on when he was small, adding that he nowadays falls asleep with the television on. "Being alone in the dark is something I don't like. I'm not the most courageous guy in the world outside...the court," Nadal had earlier stated. "I won't go on the motorbike," he had further said.

347.title: Tiger Global hit by $17 bn losses in tech stock sell-off: Report
347.article_body: Tiger Global has faced losses of around $17 billion during this year's technology stock sell-off, the Financial Times reported. The firm has erased around two-thirds of its gains in four months, the report added citing calculations by LCH Investments. The losses are reportedly higher than some of the $4-trillion hedge fund industry's most recent losses.

348.title: Group pelts stones at vehicles on highway in MP; several injured
348.article_body: Several people were injured after a group of unknown people pelted stones at vehicles on a four-lane highway on the outskirts of Madhya Pradesh's Badnawar town, police said on Tuesday. The group did so with the intention of theft, however, the occupants didn't stop their vehicles, Free Press Journal reported. The police arrested two people while the others ran away.

349.title: Indian in Dubai stalks, sends lewd messages to Gurugram woman, held
349.article_body: A 30-year-old UP resident working as a domestic servant in Dubai was arrested for stalking a Gurugram woman and sending her sexually suggestive messages, police said on Monday.
