"The accused claims he doesn't know the woman and he started sending her obscene messages and videos after she replied to her initial messages," said Arti, SHO Women Police Station, Manesar.

350.title: Mentally challenged man hangs himself after killing wife in Tripura
350.article_body: A mentally challenged man hanged himself after killing his wife in a remote village in Tripura. According to police, the incident occurred on Monday when Somen Nath was having lunch with his father-in-law while his wife was serving the food. Somen then allegedly hit his wife with an iron rod after his father-in-law went in to wash hands, police said.

351.title: Actor-model Jethro Lazenby, son of Australian singer Nick Cave, dies at 31
351.article_body: Australian actor-model Jethro Lazenby has passed away at the age of 31. The news of his demise was shared by his father, singer-songwriter Nick Cave. "We'd be grateful for family privacy at this time," he said in a statement. In 2015, Nick's son Arthur died in an accidental fall from a cliff near Brighton, England, at the age of 15.

352.title: 28.5% adults in India are hypertensive: Nationwide survey
352.article_body: In India, 28.5% of adults are hypertensive, according to a multi-centric national survey conducted by the ICMR - National Centre for Disease Informatics and Research. Among them, 27.9% were aware of their hypertensive status, 14.5% were under treatment and 12.6% had their blood pressure under control, according to the survey.

353.title: Man covers bike's number plate with face mask in Hyderabad; fined
353.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police on Sunday fined a motorist for covering his bike's number plate with a face mask at Rasoolpura, according to a report. The motorist has also been fined for breaking the bike's front number plate. Sharing the information about this incident on Twitter, Hyderabad City Police warned citizens and said, "You could be the next...Correct your improper plates."

354.title: Sri Lankan Prez extends nationwide curfew till May 11 amid unrest
354.article_body: Amid the unrest over economic crisis, Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Tuesday extended the nationwide curfew till May 11. "I instruct everybody not to use any public roads, railways, public parks, public recreation areas or other public territories or the seashore from 7 pm (local time) on May 9 to 7 am on May 11," a presidential decree said.

355.title: Shimron Hetmyer blessed with first child, RR share video
355.article_body: RR batter Shimron Hetmyer has been blessed with his first child. RR took to Instagram to share a video of Hetmyer holding the newborn in his arms and wrote, "The newest (and the cutest) addition to our #RoyalsFamily. Congratulations, @shetmyer and @tequila_goddess_nu." Hetmyer had gone to Guyana for his child's birth and is expected to join RR squad later.

356.title: We aim to end maths phobia: 22-yr-old 'fastest human calculator' on his startup
356.article_body: Neelakantha Bhanu Prakash, the 22-year-old Indian called the 'world's fastest human calculator' for his mental calculation, founded maths edtech startup Bhanzu in 2020. "We aim to eradicate maths phobia and encourage careers in maths and STEM fields," he said. Bhanzu, which provides experiential maths learning courses online, raised its $2 million seed round led by ﻿Lightspeed in February 2022.

357.title: SBI hikes interest rates on bulk term deposits from today
357.article_body: SBI has increased interest rates on its bulk term deposits of ₹2 crore and above across all its tenors except for the 7-45 days tenor. Effective from May 10, for the 46-179 days tenor, the rate has been increased to 3.50% from 3% and for 180-210 days tenor, the rate has been hiked to 3.50% from 3.10%.

358.title: Helen to make acting comeback after 10 years with Karisma-starrer 'Brown...'
358.article_body: Actress Helen will make her comeback to acting after nearly 10 years, with a drama series titled 'Brown - The First Case' starring Karisma Kapoor. It will be directed by Abhinay Deo who helmed the film 'Delhi Belly'. Helen was last seen in 2012 film 'Heroine' which featured Kareena Kapoor Khan. "I was nervous...[about] how things have changed," said Helen.

359.title: I'm glad I chose such a strong project for my OTT debut: Kangana on Lock Upp
359.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, who hosted the recently concluded reality show 'Lock Upp', has called the show an "absolute game-changer in the OTT reality space". She added she's glad that she chose "such a strong and impactful project" for her OTT debut. "The country loved a bold yet original concept...and I'd an incredible time playing...host in this badass jail," said Kangana.

360.title: There's no fear of world in their game: Gavaskar on IPL debutants GT
360.article_body: Commenting on Gujarat Titans' form in IPL 2022, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said the IPL debutants are performing well and winning because "there's no fear of the world in their game". He added, "They are enjoying their game and playing positive cricket." GT are currently placed second on the points table, having won eight out of 11 matches so far.

361.title: Nordic defence will get boost if Finland, Sweden join NATO: Minister
361.article_body: Nordic region's defence capabilities will receive a boost if Finland and Sweden decide to join NATO, Swedish Defence Minister Peter Hultqvist said on Tuesday. The countries' joint membership would allow mutual defence planning within NATO's framework, he added. Hultqvist's comments come after Sweden's ruling party said that it'll announce its stance on the country's potential membership on May 15.

362.title: New York Times drops 'fetus' as Wordle solution amid abortion rights row in US
362.article_body: The New York Times, which owns 'Wordle', on Monday removed the word "fetus" as the game's solution to keep it "distinct from the news". This comes amid a row over the leaked Supreme Court draft opinion which indicated that abortion rights may be restricted in the US. The paper warned that some users may still see the outdated answer.

363.title: New Indian VPN regulations are an assault on privacy: ProtonVPN
363.article_body: VPN service ProtonVPN, operated by a Swiss company, called India's new VPN regulations "an assault on privacy", adding that they "threaten to put citizens under a microscope of surveillance". "We remain committed to our no-logs policy," it added. The new VPN regulations released by CERT-In require VPN service providers to collect and hold user data for five years or longer.

364.title: Jharkhand Mining Secretary appears before ED in money laundering case
364.article_body: Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal on Tuesday appeared before the Enforcement Directorate (ED) for questioning in a money laundering case linked to alleged embezzlement of ₹18-crore MGNREGA funds, officials said. The ED is expected to record Singhal's statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. It had briefly questioned her during raids that were conducted against her on May 6.

365.title: 'Holy man' whose followers ate his faeces arrested in Thailand; police find 11 dead bodies
365.article_body: Police in northeastern Thailand have arrested a self-proclaimed holy man whose followers ate his faeces and drank his urine as a cure for sickness, officials said on Monday. Officers raided the thatched house of 75-year-old Thawee Nanra on Sunday deep in a jungle in Chaiyaphum province. Police said they found 11 corpses on the premises.

366.title: Bumrah showed us the tough length to bowl on DY Patil pitch: KKR's Cummins
366.article_body: Crediting Jasprit Bumrah for his bowling against KKR in IPL 2022, KKR pacer Pat Cummins(3/22) said the MI pacer showed them the tough length to bowl on DY Patil Stadium pitch on Monday. Bumrah's first five-wicket haul in IPL helped reduce KKR from 136/3 in the 14th over to 165/9 after 20. KKR beat MI by 52 runs.

367.title: Issues like Ayodhya visit taking priority instead of inflation: Pawar
367.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that while issues like Ayodhya visit and reciting prayers are taking priority, the Centre has “failed” in tackling the problems of inflation and unemployment. His statement comes ahead of MNS chief Raj Thackeray’s visit to Ayodhya on June 5. Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray will also be visiting Ayodhya on June 10.

368.title: 27-yr-old woman kills self over husband's house not having toilet
368.article_body: A 27-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide following arguments with her husband over his house not having a toilet in Tamil Nadu's Cuddalore. The couple reportedly had been in a relationship for two years and got married in April. However, the deceased was apparently living with her mother after realising her husband's house didn't have a toilet.

369.title: Was trying to avoid pothole: Driver as bus crashes into pillar in B'luru
369.article_body: After a bus crashed into a metro pillar in Bengaluru, causing injuries to 29 people, the bus driver told the police that he lost control over the vehicle when he was trying to avoid a pothole, a report stated. However, police reportedly said the accident was caused by overspeeding and rash driving. Four passengers were seriously injured in the accident.

370.title: Molotov cocktails thrown at another anti-abortion office in US
370.article_body: An anti-abortion organisation was reportedly attacked using Molotov cocktails in US' Oregon. The police said that one or more persons tried to break into the building, failing which they hurled two Molotov cocktails at it. Notably, in a similar incident that took place around the same time, an anti-abortion centre was attacked by Molotov cocktails and set ablaze in Wisconsin.

371.title: India this year alone extended support worth $3.5 billion to Sri Lankan people: Govt
371.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Sri Lanka, India's External Affair Ministry said, "In keeping with our Neighbourhood First policy, India has extended this year alone support worth over $3.5 billion to people of Sri Lanka for helping them overcome their current difficulties." "India will always be guided by best interests of Sri Lankan people expressed through democratic processes," it added.

372.title: Maisie Williams & Freddie Highmore to star in comedy film 'Sinner V. Saints'
372.article_body: 'Game of Thrones' star Maisie Williams and 'The Good Doctor' actor Freddie Highmore are set to star in the comedy film 'Sinner v. Saints'. Written by Jill Hoppe, it is based on the real-life story of an eccentric MENSA beauty queen who abducted a Mormon missionary in 1970s, according to The Hollywood Reporter. It will be directed by Tim Kirkby.

373.title: We're running shops in mall he built: Ranveer on SRK's impact on B'wood
373.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh called Shah Rukh Khan a "pioneer" of Indian entertainment and said, "He is king for a reason." "I was joking the other day, in Shah Rukh's presence. I was telling a third person...he has built this mall where we are running our small shops," he added. Ranveer stated he has a "great amount of respect" for him.

374.title: Piyush Goyal calls for decriminalisation of Legal Metrology Act
374.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday called for the decriminalisation of the Legal Metrology Act 2009 which seeks to establish and enforce weights and measures standards in the country. "It’s our collective responsibility to ensure that the consumers do not face injustice while at the same time understanding the responsibility towards businessmen so that they can work peacefully," Goyal said.

375.title: 4 dead, 13 injured in road accident in Rajasthan; CM expresses grief
375.article_body: At least four people died and 13 others were injured as the tractor-trolley in which they were travelling overturned after being hit by a truck in Rajasthan's Kota. According to police, the incident occurred on Tuesday morning when the victims were returning from a wedding in Batawda village. CM Ashok Gehlot expressed his deepest condolences over the incident.

376.title: El Salvador buys $15 million worth of Bitcoin as it briefly drops below $30,000
376.article_body: El Salvador's President Nayib Bukele on Tuesday took to Twitter to announce that the country has purchased 500 Bitcoins worth more than $15 million. "El Salvador just bought the dip," Bukele said, adding that the coins were bought at an average price of $30,744. The country's purchase comes after Bitcoin briefly fell below $30,000 for first time since July 2021.

377.title: Ex-Facebook moderator sues Meta over working conditions in Kenya
377.article_body: A former moderator working for Meta has filed a lawsuit against it alleging poor working conditions for contracted content moderators in Kenya. The suit alleges workers moderating Facebook posts have been subjected to unreasonable working conditions including irregular pay and inadequate mental health support. Meta's local outsourcing company Sama has been sued as well.

378.title: Operating rooms major contributor to carbon emissions in health sector: Study
378.article_body: As per study, operating rooms make the biggest contribution to carbon emissions within the health sector. Operating rooms generate 70% of the hospital's waste responsible for greenhouse gas emissions. They generate three to six times as much carbon as the rest of health systems, for example, a robotic-assisted hysterectomy produces carbon equivalent to driving over 3,000 kilometres in a car.

379.title: Adopting child directly from parents is not an offence: K'taka HC
379.article_body: Adopting a child directly from parents, where the kid is not abandoned or surrendered or an orphan, does not constitute an offence, the Karnataka High Court has said. The court said this while quashing proceedings against two couples in the Magistrate court. A couple, who had delivered twin girls in 2018, had given one of the children to another couple.

380.title: It’s PM’s resolve to make India global drone hub leader by 2030: Scindia
380.article_body: It is the resolve of PM Narendra Modi to make India the International Drone Hub leader by 2030, Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday. "We have to lead the world in this field. Our Ministry is working along with NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant," Scindia added. "We are taking this forward on the basis of three wheels," Scindia stated.

381.title: Punjab attack could have been on Shimla Police HQ: Khalistan group warns Himachal CM
381.article_body: After a rocket-propelled grenade was fired at the Intelligence Wing headquarters of Punjab Police in Mohali, Khalistani outfit Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) warned Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur that the attack could have been on Shimla Police headquarters. "Learn from the grenade attack at Mohali. This grenade attack could have been on Shimla headquarters," SFJ chief Gurpatwant Singh Pannun said.

382.title: Stone-pelting reported as communal clash erupts in Gujarat, 7 detained
382.article_body: Seven persons were detained by police after some members of two communities clashed in the Kaalol town of Gujarat's Panchmahal district, a police officer said on Tuesday. The clash took place when two persons dancing in a wedding procession picked up a fight over a minor issue, Panchmahal SP said. Members of both the communities indulged in stone-pelting, police said.

383.title: BJP books Dalit, Adivasi youths who challenge them: Jignesh Mevani
383.article_body: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani on Tuesday claimed that if youths from OBC, Dalit or Adivasi communities challenge the BJP or RSS, then they're booked under false cases like him. The BJP should take back all these cases, he said. He also claimed that the BJP refuses to identify Adivasis by their "true identity" and instead calls them "Vanbandhu and Vanvasi".

384.title: Change names of roads linked to Mughal slavery: Delhi BJP chief
384.article_body: Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta on Tuesday wrote to the New Delhi Municipal Council, seeking a change in the names of roads that, he said, are a "symbol of Mughal slavery". Last month, Gupta had spoken about the change in names required for 40 villages. "We are getting lots of requests from these villages to change their names," he said.

385.title: 2 new flyover projects at Delhi's Anand Vihar, Punjabi Bagh approved
385.article_body: Delhi government on Tuesday approved two new flyover projects in the east and west Delhi and added that these will be completed in one-and-a-half years. The new flyovers will be built between Anand Vihar and Apsara Border, and the other between Punjabi Bagh and Raja Garden. "These projects are vital for decongesting city traffic," Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said.

386.title: Sanjay told Big B 'I'm leaving because of Mukul': Manoj Desai on 'Khuda Gawah'
386.article_body: 'Khuda Gawah' producer Manoj Desai said that Sanjay Dutt had told Amitabh Bachchan that he was leaving the film because of director Mukul Anand. Desai said they had shot seven reels of the film with Sanjay but later actor Nagarjuna was cast for the role. "Mukul Anand...wanted to shoot his...ads free of cost in Nagarjuna's studio...Nagarjuna bagged...role," he added.

387.title: Blue Origin mission to fly first Mexican-origin woman to space
387.article_body: Billionaire Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin has announced that NS-21 mission, the company's fifth human spaceflight, will include the first Mexican-origin woman to visit space. Katya Echazarreta, 26, is an electrical engineer and ex-NASA test lead. Her seat is sponsored by Space for Humanity and she will provide representation for women and minorities interested in STEM fields, Blue Origin said.

388.title: Man rapes 2 minors in Maha on pretext of giving them roles in films
388.article_body: Police have registered a case against a man for allegedly raping two teenage girls in Maharashtra on the pretext of getting them roles in films, an official said on Tuesday. The accused took the girls to a forest and raped them repeatedly over the last year, said an official from the Mira-Bhayandar, Vasai-Virar Police control room.

389.title: Pune residents to launch 'save Taljai hills campaign' on May 15
389.article_body: Fearing depleting biodiversity, residents of Pune are set to launch 'Taljai Bachao Abhiyan' (save Taljai hills campaign) on May 15. Residents were kept aloof from the various developmental works on hill that were recently inaugurated, Indraneel Sadalge, a member of the Taljai Bachao Abhiyan, stated. "The campaign will begin...with a protest. We're also preparing for a legal battle," he added.

390.title: 15-year-old boy drowns in Mumbai's Vihar Lake
390.article_body: A 15-year-old boy drowned in the Vihar Lake in Mumbai's Powai area. The deceased, identified as Gautam Panchal, had gone for a swim on Monday afternoon but failed to estimate the depth of the water in the lake, police said. His body was taken to a hospital as soon as it was recovered where the doctors declared him dead.

391.title: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' was acting masterclass with Ranveer: Shalini
391.article_body: Actress Shalini Pandey, who will make her Bollywood debut with 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar', shared a still from the film on social media, writing that it was like an acting masterclass with Ranveer Singh. The actress called him "a giant of an actor", adding that she calls him Guruji. "I love this picture...it describes our bond, a natural connection...we formed," Shalini wrote.

392.title: There's lot of noise outside but it doesn't affect me: MI pacer Bumrah
392.article_body: MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah said he knows there's a lot of "noise outside" about his form in ongoing IPL but it doesn't affect him. "Because I'm not a person who judges my performance on what others think or what...experts are saying," he added. Bumrah, who took his maiden fifer in IPL on Monday, has taken 10 wickets from 11 matches.

393.title: I left him confused sometimes: Ex-Real Madrid keeper López on Messi
393.article_body: Ex-Real Madrid goalkeeper Diego López said he managed to confuse former Barcelona forward Lionel Messi sometimes. "The best players I have had in front of me over the years are Cristiano Ronaldo and Messi. I was lucky enough to be Cristiano’s partner for two years," added López. López is the first goalkeeper to save two penalties by the Argentine.

394.title: 'Monster quake' occurs on Mars; 'biggest ever on another planet', says NASA
394.article_body: NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory has detected a magnitude 5 "monster quake" on Mars, which it said was "the biggest ever detected on another planet". The tremblor occurred on May 4, 2022, which was the 1,222nd Martian day of the mission involving NASA's InSight Mars lander. On Earth, the tremor would have been considered medium-sized, NASA said.

395.title: Ex-CEC Sunil Arora joins agri-tech startup as non-executive chairman
395.article_body: The former Chief Election Commissioner of India Sunil Arora has joined agri-tech startup 'Gram Unnati' as its new non-executive chairman. Founded in 2013 by IIT-Kharagpur graduate Aneesh Jain, Gram Unnati provides advisory services and access to quality inputs at low costs among other things. Prior to this, Arora has also served in the Ministry of Skill Development and Entrepreneurship.

396.title: Women dance on vulgar songs with goddess', PM's images in background at MP event
396.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh government has suspended Mandsaur's chief municipal officer after videos showing women dancing on vulgar songs with a goddess' image in background at an event surfaced on social media. Pictures of PM Narendra Modi and other leaders were also seen on the banner in the background. State minister Hardeep Singh Dang had demanded action against chief municipal officer.

397.title: Sonu Sood asks for 50 liver transplants worth ₹12 crore as fees to promote a hospital
397.article_body: Sonu Sood, speaking to The Man magazine, recalled how he gave the money from his last few endorsements to charity. Citing an example, he said, "A gentleman...from Aster Hospitals connected with me...and said the group would like to collaborate with me...I said that I'll promote the hospitals, but give me 50 liver transplants. That's almost ₹12 crore in value."

398.title: Bumrah shares pic of match ball after posting his best figures in T20 cricket
398.article_body: MI fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took to Instagram to share a picture of the match ball after he recorded his best figures in T20 cricket. Bumrah, who registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR on Monday, wrote, "Disappointed with last night's result but a memorable evening nevertheless." It was Bumrah's first-ever five-wicket haul in T20 cricket.

399.title: BJP created 2 Indias, Cong will form next govt in Gujarat: Rahul
399.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has accused BJP of creating "two Indias" at a rally in Dahod, Gujarat. "One for the rich and one for the poor, resources of the country belonging to poor people are being given to a few rich people," Gandhi said. The 51-year-old politician also claimed that Congress will form the next government in Gujarat.

400.title: Sri Lanka's ex-PM flees to naval base with family amid violent protests: Reports
400.article_body: Sri Lanka's former PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and his family members have reportedly taken shelter at a naval base after violent protests erupted all over the country, amid its worst economic crisis. The Rajapaksas are putting up at Trincomalee Naval Base after fleeing their official residence in Colombo, reports said. Videos showed protests underway in front of the naval base.

401.title: Depp, team celebrate as Heard claims he pushed Kate Moss down stairs
401.article_body: A video shows Johnny Depp and his legal team celebrating after his ex-wife Amber Heard testified he pushed supermodel Kate Moss down the stairs. Heard was testifying in the ongoing defamation trial against her and recounted the first incident she hit Depp which involved her sister. Heard had earlier claimed that people told her Depp pushed Kate down the stairs.
